How to Create Blockbuster Box Office Hits with Your Players – Every Adventure
198188.description: How to Create Blockbuster Box Office Hits with Your Players – Every Adventure

198190.description:
The year is 3042: Humanity is ready to explore the galaxy. The most interesting celestial bodies to explore, and eventually colonize, have been known for centuries, and the nations of Earth finally have the technological level to reach them, thus beginning an unarmed competition that in the end the whole of humanity will win.

Kepler-3042 is a resource management game in which you have to explore, colonize, exploit, and terraform the planets of the Milky Way using the available technologies. In each round, you must choose which action to perform and which bonus to activate, managing your supplies of matter, energy and antimatter. The peculiar strength of the game is the innovative resource management: Each player has a finite amount of matter, energy and antimatter that they can produce or spend during the game. In each round, they can decide to burn forever one or more resources to perform powerful actions, thereby allowing them to follow different strategies.
198190.name: Kepler-3042
boardgamepodcastepisode: Anticipazioni Essen SPIEL 2016 – Il Dado Incantato #10
Episode 101 -- Gettin' Roast Beef to San Francisco
Heavy Cardboard Episode 59 – December (2016) Briefing
I postumi di Spiel 2016 – Il Dado Incantato #12
The Game Pit: Episode 74 - Spiel ‘16 Treasure Hunt Part 4

198191.name: White Mirror
198191.description:
User Summary

You search through an old house following the instructions left for you. Signs of murder and horror surface as you do basic things, like sleep or turn on the power.

198192.name: Feed-A-Frog
198192.description: Divide up into two teams and throw a bug token to the hungry frog. Each team takes a turn until all tokens are played. The team that feeds the frog with the most bugs is the winner.

198193.name: Balancing Tree
198193.description: The player that can stack and balance the tree and the birds quickest, without making it fall is the winner.

198194.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 15 - Punchtastic)
198194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: Want more from your super-brawls? Here you go, with Punchtastic!

198195.name: Mythos Epic Gamemastering (Savage Worlds)
198195.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Olympians have spoken and you are to join the ranks of heroes and heroines involved in the Heavenly Contest! The Olympian deities are in a race to find the successor to Zeus’s throne, with the successor acquiring the greatest number of followers. But the gods and goddesses are quite busy, and to shine their light upon the mortals of Hellas requires intervention of a divine scale. Heroic deeds are a must if one is to prove themselves worthy for the gratification of Olympus and the pursuit of seeing their patron deity rise to rulership! Are you strong, brave, and smart enough for the challenge? We will see how you fair against the great beasts of Hellas and the heroes and heroines who support your rival deity. This is the Heavenly Contest. This is Mythos!

In Mythos, you assume the role of a demigod or devoted human of the gods and goddesses of Olympus in a heroic mythological representation of Ancient Greece. Heroes and heroines join in the Heavenly Contest to prove their worth to the deities and spread the word of their patron deity to the mortals of Hellas, in hopes of raising their patron deity to the Olympus throne. Heroes and heroines come from all walks of life, representing their patron deity as adventurers, fighters, hoplites, Olympic athletes, courtesans, sages, and rogues. Through affiliations with deific cults and Mystery Cults, they gain access to great powers and follow the strands of Fate as they travel Hellas in search of their next, grand performance.

Inside Epic Gamemastering you will find:

An introduction to Hellas and it's major locations
GM's guide to creating epic campaigns
Random adventure creator
A collection of epic tales
A large collection of epic fiends to throw at your heroes
An introductory adventure
… and more!

198196.name: One Hundred Ways
198196.description:
100 tricky levels to solve One Hundred Ways. The goal - to make the ball reach its goal - sounds simple - but it is not! To solve the levels, there are some tools available. Sometimes one needs to think outside the box to overcome obstacles. In December 2015 the game got a 15 level upgrade for more fun!

Features:
100 levels for a lot of gaming fun
Plus 15 level for more fun, released in December 2015
10 tutorial levels
Modern interface
Over 30 tools that make it either more difficult or easier for the ball to reach its goal
Slowly increasing difficulty
Real time 3D-Iso-view

Source: The Developer Website.

198197.name: Your Quest
198197.description:
User Summary

An RPG at heart, this game also involves survival aspects as you gather resources to build items. The visuals are 2D retro pixels.

198198.name: Smoke
198198.description:
User summary
The third game from Kunpu is bound to stir up some controversy amongst our current health-concerned society.

Smoking has been labeled as a dirty habit.
Increasingly more places are banning smoking and the price of cigarettes is continuously raised. Tobacco has been villainized to the point that there are specialized clinics and monetary rewards from employers for quitting.

But to heavy smokers, cigarettes are a simple pleasure.

The players of this game become heavy smokers trying to smoke as many cigarettes as possible before their lungs turn completely black. Even if you fail to smoke during a round, your lungs may still grow progressively blacker all the same from the secondhand smoke of your peers.

This game is both for those who are proud to call themselves smokers and those who disdain them. Outwit your fellow smokers to puff your way to victory (and an early grave).

Game Play
Each player gets an ashtray in which they place smoked cigarettes.

-Draw 3 cards
-Players choose 1-2 cards to place face-down on the table (one card must be a cigarette card)
-Players open the chosen cards at the same time
-The player with the highest number of cigarettes wins (unless special cards are involved)
-The winning player can smoke that round (therefore he collects the cigarettes into his ashtray). However, he also must gather tokens that mark the deterioration of his lungs, based on the number of tokens written on the card(s) he played.
-The losing players cannot smoke (they discard their opened cards) but they may receive the effect of secondhand smoke from the winner's played cards. They gather tokens according to this lung cost.
-Refill hand and continue until someone reaches 10 lung tokens (and therefore dies of blackened lungs).

The ultimate winner (even in death) is the person who smoked the most.

198199.name: Mutiny Anyone?
198199.description:
A fun and fast paced game of negotiation on the high seas. Beautiful and silly illustrations come to life as players struggle between helping the Captain voyage to new and promising lands or causing a raucous and leading to mutiny.

Game play is a simultaneous action, keeping everyone engaged and guessing, as they each try to become the Captain for the day. The captain will find themselves challenged in thought provoking actions that can appease their crew or sail on towards their own agenda.

198200.name: Space Trader
198200.description:
User Summary

You are the captain of a space ship and trying to earn enough money to purchase your own moon to be able to retire. You earn money in one of several ways: trading legitime or contraband goods, becoming a bounty hunter, or becoming a pirate.

198201.name: Worst Case Z
198201.description:
Worst Case Z is a first-person survival horror game, in which you take a role of security worker in a nuclear power plant in the middle of a city. After a meltdown and a huge explosion in one of the reactors during the night shift, you are under shock.

Source: The Game Website.

198202.name: Der Schuh des Manitu: Das Brettspiel
198202.description:
Whether wadding blow on the Puder Rosa or mime with Abahachi. Or would you rather make a rhyme with Ranger about Santa Maria? Skill, creativity and wit will bring you nearer to coveted treasure map. And in between you are allowed laugh until the Shoshone come ...
With this communication and party game each round will get in mood!

198203.name: Plot Twist: A Storytelling Card Game
198203.description:
Plot Twist is a storytelling card game for four to six players. All players are Storytellers and stitch together Plot Cards, combined with a little imagination, to tell short stories prompted by Trope Cards.

Trope Cards provide a familiar story prompt inspired from all over fiction, media, and history. Storytellers use this information to tell a story using their hand of Plot Cards.

Plot Cards contain tired clichés, action beats, random events, and hilarious happenings. Storytellers stitch together as many Plot Cards as they need to tell their version of the selected Trope Card prompt, making up the events between cards as they go. Stories can be simple tales, outrageous romps, or outright-insane cartoons – as long as you can justify the Plot Cards you use in your story, you can use them however you'd like!

After all Storytellers have told their stories for the round, they cast votes for their favorite stories of the round. Votes in Plot Twist are weighted – you get three Story Point Cards to use each round and you can give them out however you want. Feel free to spread your votes around to multiple Storytellers, or give all three to your favorite story!

The story with the most votes at the end of each round wins that round's Trope Card as a point. The Storyteller with the most points at the end of the game is crowned the Master Storyteller – and the winner of the game!

198204.name: Tome of Tomes Volume Three
198204.description:
From publisher blurb:

Books in fantasy games have always been sources of mystery. We're all familiar with the sight of the magic user's eyes lighting up like a 5-year-old at Christmas when one is found. This work provides 100 more tomes for your gaming pleasure, ranging from the magical to the mundane, from the common to the unique. Never again will you be at a loss to describe that recently found libram.

Tome of Tomes Volume Three is a compilation of books that could be found on a sage's shelf or on the shelves of a city library. Each tome is described and classified according to field of study and special knowledge category (if applicable).

198205.name: Cthulhu Wars: The Tcho-Tcho Expansion
198205.description:
The Tcho-Tcho Expansion adds a new faction to Cthulhu Wars. The Tcho-Tchos are a human-based faction representing the physically advanced, but ethically repulsive Tcho-Tcho tribe with the ability to interfere with other players by worshipping their Great Old Ones! Your own Great Old One, Ubbo-Sathla, is a tool and slave, not an object of worship!

Unique among Cthulhu Wars factions, the Tcho-Tchos have access to three high priests. In addition to the standard power generation and pacing benefits granted by recruiting additional high priests, the Tcho-Tchos exploit this advantage through two spellbooks (Hierophants and Martydom) based around high priests. The other distinction of the Tcho-Tchos is the way they interact with other factions; the spellbooks Tablet of the Gods and Idolotry enable the Tcho-Tcho faction to leech off other players, and Soulless makes your cultists less attractive to capture.

The Tcho-Tchos are generally weak defensively at first, but enemies are typically reluctant to attack an Area containing your High Priests (due to Martyrdom). If they don’t send in Great Old Ones, the riff-raff can often be handled with Proto-Shoggoths--particularly with the Terror spellbook. The Tcho-Tchos have a major power advantage in the early game, because you normally spend 0 Power on your Great Old One. This power can be used not only to capture or build Gates, but to place units in enemy Start Areas to harass them with Tablets of the Gods.

198206.description:
In SuperP.L.E.X. Wrestling, players each take the role of an intergalactic pro wrestling superstar and battle it out with over-the-top moves in hopes of being the last wrestler standing!

Players start off by assembling their unique hand of 6 maneuver cards, which they will use as their arsenal in the battle ahead. Players also position their wrestlers on a "Ring", which will become an important part of their assault, as where they and their opponent are in the ring at any given time could equal some BIG damage opportunities...if you play your moves right!

Played over the course of rounds, each round starts with a "Lock-Up" in order to determine who will start with the offensive edge. After the Lock-Up, each player then position their maneuver cards as "Offense" or "Defense" depending on who won the Lock-Up. One by one, players reveal their face down maneuver cards to see if the player on Defense was able to correctly guess what type of maneuver their opponent played. If they guess correctly, the opponent's maneuver is countered and the Defensive player now goes on the Offense! If they guessed wrong, the player on Offense gets to execute their maneuver!

Maneuvers become more and more deadly the further along in a combo they are, so do your best to juke and jive your Defensive opponent to get the most out of your combo! The wrestlers themselves get more deadly as well! Once a wrestler's stamina goes below 1/2, they get to add their super effective Finishing Maneuver card to their arsenal to help turn the tide of battle!
198206.name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

198207.description:
TIN
SOLDIERS
IN ACTION

FAIR And SQAURE Rules

From 1680 Until About 1914

FAIR old school AND fast play rules, which are made for all sizes, shapes or organizations for the true passionate collector of tin soldiers, played on SQUARES!

Guiding principles of TIN SOLDIERS IN ACTION:
Tin soldiers games should be fun and decisive –

fair and fast
simple and harsh
clear verdicts
direct results
high adrenalin level
no discussion
no measuring
no vague situations




Just decisions and a lot of FUN with TIN SOLDIERS IN ACTION!

TIN SOLDIERS IN ACTION, FAIR and SQUARES Rules cover

the age of Enlightenment
the Napoleonic age
the Victorian era
all scales
all types of basing
solo games
skirmishes and large battles with a single rule system.




Included are

army lists from 1680 up to 1900
point systems and modular systems for army constructions
a tutorial on the American Civil War in a military academy setting
a detailed scenario of the Battle of Bergen in the Seven Years War
a fantastic scenario Black Cup in the Victorian era in a Jules Verne setting




Unique rules which will test YOUR courage:

YOU are commander-in-chief of YOUR tin soldiers, in charge of strategy, seizing the opportunities – every move must be a conscious act.

YOU are directly confronted with the stark consequences YOUR decisions.

Will YOU demonstrate true nerves of steel? Will you lead your tin soldiers to victory? Share in the excitement and thrilling experience of TIN SOLDIERS IN ACTION!
198207.name: Tin Soldiers in Action
boardgameaccessory: Tin Soldiers in Action: Grassland Terrain Mat

198209.name: Liebes Spiel
198209.description:
A journey into the world of feelings
With exciting and erotic game instructions

It turns throwing and advanced on a path the corresponding number of spaces . Then, the instructions on the destination field will be followed. The goal is to get to know each other and may be the first to reach the 'Love Nest'.

198210.name: Cthulhu Wars: The Library of Celaeno Map Expansion
198210.description:
The Library of Celaeno Expansion contains a new map with two figures, the Librarian and the Custodian. This map is inside the cyclopean alien facility in the Hyades, renowned in Lovecraft Lore. This map includes Special Collections, where the first player to build a Gate can seize amazing new powers in the form of extra spellbooks. But beware! If you lose control of your Special Collection, your new spellbook becomes overdue, and the terrifying Librarian menaces you.

The Custodian cleans up chambers by moving units in the Area to an Area termed the Oubliette. Over the course of the game, this Oubliette tends to get filled with units, Sometimes fights break out.

The Librarian can only be activated if a player has an overdue Book, in which case it can wreak some real damage. Fortunately, you can mitigate the damage by returning the Book, though not necessarily eliminate all threat.

The Library of Celaeno introduces a new mechanism in Cthulhu Wars: Silence tokens. These are are used to trigger certain special actions including moving the Custodian, Librarian, and triggering some of the special Library books on this map.

198211.name: The Flavour Handbook
198211.description:
From the back cover:

In this book Gregory Ducker gives life to a seldom recognized
aspect of table top gaming: food. From Classes, to Spells, to Feats, and even Articles The Flavour Handbook is brimming with new, brilliant content.

But beyond the statistical wonder of this book, there is also a
personality and whimsy that’s difficult to find anywhere else. Gregory Ducker does a fantastic job of bringing to life the importance of food in a way palatable for both the most experienced, or newest player.

198212.description:
The well-known and most popular dice game enters a new dimension. Now the points just acquired may be pilfered from other players. And now is the "road" away ... but wait, I'll get it back again!

Das bekannte und weltweit beliebte Würfelspiel erfährt eine neue Dimension. Nun können die gerade erworbenen Punkte von den Mitspielern stibitzt werden. Und schon ist die "Straße" weg... doch warte nur, die hol' ich mir wieder!
198212.name: Super Yatzi

198213.name: Verge: Lost Chapter
198213.description:
User Summary

You are a rehabilitated mental patient whose truck breaks down in the rain and you find shelter in an abandoned religious institution. Although there are long loads and unskippable printed narration, the game only lasts about 15-30 minutes.

198214.name: Shindra
198214.description:
Shindra is a tactical 2-player boardgame opposing the gods of two civilizations.

The aim of the game is to have more cards on the board showing your color than your opponent's at the end of the game.

The game progresses with each player placing a card on a 4 by 4 grid and flipping the neighboring opponent's cards with a cascading effect. Once the grid is full, the player with the most cards in their color wins.

You can play a partnership game with 2 boxes.

rpgissuearticle: Adventure Design Tip: How Do You use Chekhov's Gun in Gaming?
Reader GM Tip Request: How Do You Track All the Details of a Living World?

rpgissuearticle: "I Love You I Love You," said the Little Blue Man
The Order of the Veiled Eyes

198219.name: Journey to Beneath Wyvern Tor
198219.description:
From the introduction:

The Ghost Tribe of Orcs were driven from their home under
Wyvern Tor by some terrible evil. They marched to Phandalin and attacked, only to be defeated. Now the heroes will go beneath Wyvern Tor to discover the terror that chased out the orcs and perhaps find the source of the orc’s sardonyx. Journey to Beneath Wyvern Tor is the third of four parts in the After Lost Mine series. It will play out the journey to the orc’s former cave settlement and then into the darkness beneath. Part IV will have the party deal with the terror from the Underdark that drove out the orcs.

198220.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 526)
rpgissuearticle: 8 Ways to Make Game World Management Easy
Listen to these Great Recorded Game Sessions
198220.description:
Contents:


Reader Tip Request: GMing Western RPGs
8 Ways to Make Game World Management Easy
Listen To These Great Recorded Game Sessions
One More Tip: Make Levels 1-4 Your PC's Background

198221.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 527)
rpgissuearticle: How To Lie And Get Caught At It
198221.description:
Contents:


How To Lie And Get Caught At It
How Do You Prevent Metagaming?
Game Master Tips & Tricks

198222.name: Pocket Dungeon Thief
198222.description:
Play the role of a thief Searching Dungeons, lock picking treasure chests, pickpocket other players, battle monsters and dungeon bosses for gold and loot!

Pocket Dungeon Thief is a 1 to 3 player card and dice game. Each player draws cards from the search, treasure and loot decks to collect items, gold and loot. Treasure chests are lock picked with the thief dice and monsters or dungeon bosses are confronted with the battle dice.

Combinations of sneaky tactics can be performed to outwit your opponents to gain an edge, for shiny coins!

But gathering gold does come at a price... A treasure chest can be cursed and spawn one of four dungeon bosses that every thief player must unite and battle

198223.name: Cthulhu Wars: Great Old One Pack Four
198223.description:
Cthulhu Wars: Great Old One Pack Four adds three new Great Old Ones to Cthulhu Wars. As in the other Great Old One Packs, each Old One may be added to any game of Cthulhu Wars and is available to all factions on a first come, first served basis. Each Great Old One has its own special ability, plus its own unique spellbook, which is earned separately from your own.

The Old Ones in this pack are Byatis, Nyogtha, and Tulzscha. Byatis lures enemy cultists to their doom, Tulszcha subverts the purpose of the Ritual track, and Nyogtha takes prisoners away to its lair.

198224.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 528)
rpgissuearticle: How To Turn A Haunted House Into An NPC
198224.description:
Contents:


A Brief Word From Johnn
5 Effective Combat Tactics For Assassins
Reader Tips: Game World Management
How To Turn A Haunted House Into An NPC
One More Tip: Start World Design With NPCs

rpgissuearticle: How to Contact and Hire an Assassin NPC
198225.description:
Contents:


A Brief Word From Johnn
How to Contact and Hire an Assassin NPC
Riddleport Session 23 – Dragonspawn Bitchslap
How-To Game Master Books
One More Tip: GMing A Western RPG

198226.name: Cthulhu Wars: Cosmic Terror Pack
198226.description: The Cosmic Terrors are neutral, particularly powerful Monsters that may be added to any game of Cthulhu Wars and are available to any player on a first come, first served basis. You seize control of one by spending your Doom points, and it remains loyal thereafter. This pack includes the gigantic Dhole, destroyer of worlds; the Great Race of Yith, with the power to seize men's minds; and the demonic Quachil Uttaus entity, Treader of the Dust.

198227.name: Cthulhu Wars: Ramsey Campbell Horrors Pack One
198227.description: The Horror packs bring creations of Ramsey Campbell to Cthulhu Wars. These packs introduce neutral Great Old Ones and Monsters that may be added to any game of Cthulhu Wars; they are available to any player on a first come, first served basis. You seize control of one by spending Doom points, and they remain loyal thereafter. This pack includes two Great Old Ones - Eihort and Gla'aki. Also included is a new Monster - the famous Insects from Shaggai. You get three hives for the Insects should you demand their loyalty, so the pack includes a total of 5 large figures.

198228.name: Cthulhu Wars: Ramsey Campbell Horrors Pack Two
198228.description: The Horror packs bring creations of Ramsey Campbell to Cthulhu Wars. These packs introduce neutral Great Old Ones and Monsters that may be added to any game of Cthulhu Wars; they are available to any player on a first come, first served basis. You seize control of one by spending Doom points, and they remain loyal thereafter. This pack includes the Great Old Ones Daoloth and Y'Golonac, plus three Satyr monsters - humans degenerated through contact with the Outside - for a total of five figures.

198229.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 530)
rpgissuearticle: How to Keep Your Story and Campaign Consistent
198229.description:
Contents:


A Brief Word From Johnn
How to Keep Your Story and Campaign Consistent
Kingdom Events For 4 Seasons
One More Tip: Game Master Philosophy

A Brief Word From Johnn
Magic Items Contest Announcement
How To Create Great Magic Items In Just Three Minutes

198234.description:
Contents:


A Brief Word From Johnn
Reader Tip Request: What The Heck Is Ullamaliztli?
Top 10 Reasons Why Your Combats Are Slow, Part 1
Game Master Tips & Tricks

198236.name: Mountains of Ash
198236.description:
From publisher blurb:

After it has crossed much of the Trackless Wastes, the Ember Road abruptly ends. What it once led to, no one knows, as there is not even a remnant left anymore. Beyond the end of that road is a wasteland of ash and rotten earth. However, it is said that somewhere far beyond those mountains of ash there lies a land not yet utterly laid to waste. There are those fool enough to believe and cross the Trackless Wastes in the vain hopes of finding such a place.

198237.name: Kineticists of Porphyra III
198237.description:
From publisher blurb:

PRIMAL POWER NEVER STOPS...

When occult threats rear their hideous heads, the raw, elemental power of a kineticist will even the odds, manipulating the substance of the universe to his own design. On the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, kineticists are going to need every blast, talent, and infusion at their finger tips to survive. Within the useful pages Kineticists of Porphyra you will find:

4 new archetypes, including the Corpse Puppeteer and Dimensional Ripper!
5 new elemental saturations, including The Shadeless Citadel and The Genius Loci
Over 10 composite blasts, 11 infusions, over 60 utility wild talents, and 12 combo wild talents!
4 kineticist mutations that provide both an advantage and disadvantage to the kineticists
New feats to use all of this material, a handful of magic items, and an amazing sample character...

198238.name: Dirty Harry (2007)
198238.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




The game was to continue the story of the 1971 motion picture of the same name starring Clint Eastwood as Harry Callahan, the protagonist. Clint Eastwood was intended to reprise his role, lending his voice and likeness as well as consulting and creative input. The game was to follow the same storyline of the film, with the San Francisco detective tracking down a serial killer named Scorpio. Versions were planned for both the Sony PlayStation 3 and Microsoft Xbox 360, with a release in 2007.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirty_Harry_%282007_video_game%29 Dirty Harry (2007 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

198239.name: Dungeons of Fel'Valashar
198239.description:
From publisher blurb:

Written in celebration of Swords and Wizardry Appreciation Day 2016, Dungeons of Fel’Valashar is a collection of mini dungeon adventures with a small region called Fel’Valashar that they take place within. Each of these adventures is written in such a way that they don’t have any ties to each other or to Fel’Valashar. This means you can easily drop them into your own world with no fuss.

Includes:

Details of the Anshuar area of Fel’Valashar.
Four mini dungeon adventures.
Three monsters.
One spell.

198240.name: A Pleasant Place
198240.description:
User summary:

The game is played with one or two standard packs of French playing cards forming the basic random element. Characters are defined with narrative tags, including Duties, Attachments, and Brainfreezes (deficiencies). The game intersperses narrative development with card hands; the game progress is structured in turns.

198241.name: Babel, Inc.
198241.description:
From the introduction:

Babel, Inc. is a role-playing game for two players. One player, the Petitioner, plays a character climbing the Tower of Babel to meet the Divine (whatever the relevant form would be for them) to try to change their past and learn of the future. The other player, the Tower, plays the various trials of climbing the tower, both the different realms the petitioner must cross through and the reflections on the Petitioner’s past. The game can take on a range of tones, from comedic to dramatic or action-oriented to psychological, which the players may wish to discuss beforehand, but it will generally focus on the trials of a journey and contemplation of a character’s past and future.

198242.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 536)
198242.description: Top 10 Reasons Why Your Combats Are Slow - Part 2

198243.description:

A Brief Word From Johnn

GMing Tips: Computer Hacking In RPG
3 Easy Ways To Add More Story To Combat

198248.name: The Reward Game
198248.description:
Starting with $1.2 million in cash, players (or teams) buy and sell stocks, bonds, real estate, and gold. First player to $10 million wins.

Players start on any square on the board and move clockwise by rolling the dice. Some squares allow you to optionally buy or sell various assets, other squares require you to buy or sell assets. Asset value can change during play when a player lands on one of the "Change In Interest Rate" squares, causing the "Inflation Rate Indicator" (a plastic spinner) to move up or down, indicating a new value for everyone's assets. After the rate change, the player who landed on the square is required to sell from half to all of one of his assets.

The Inflation Rate Indicator starts at "5-10%" and during play will move up and down to "0-5%" or "10-15%". Players my borrow from the bank, but it must be paid back before someone reaches the $10 million goal.

198249.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 542)
198249.description:
Contents:


A Brief Word From Johnn
Reader Tip Request: Aquatic Adventures
Minis Tips Series Finale: Marking And Condition Tracking
The Power Of Good In Your RPG

A Brief Word From Johnn

Riddleport Session 22 - The Caverns Beneath

Reader Tip Request: How do you manage long-term campaigns?

198260.name: Cabin Wars!
198260.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by the archetype and their name. The archetype is a narrative tag meant to encapsulate the stereotype the character will fulfill in the game. During play, it is possible to gain Skills. Opposed actions are resolved by competing dice pool rolls, possibly modified by Skills or situational bonuses. Play involves narrative development of a series of "face off" style competitions between the various cabins of a summer camp.

198261.name: Elevator of the Third Eye
198261.description:
From the introduction:

You learn of your psychic powers when your witness a doorway of light. This door of light is the Elevator of the Damned. When you choose to enter the door, you are transported up or down the planes of existence to your patron. The patron is a soul from history. It can be a famous dead celebrity, an ancestor or even an animal. Whoever or whatever your patron turns out, it will guide you in the resistance. Each patron has their own agenda to help humanity achieve freedom. The patrons interact with each other and form alliances. They enable the members of the human resistance to meet and form groups.

198262.name: Bid A Letter
198262.description: Bid A Letter for a chance to go first each round. Bids are won based on alphabetical order. On your turn, use your Letter Tile to build, expand and/or change a word in one of the four Word Chains. Select your Letter carefully, have the Letter that comes first in the alphabet to win the bid and go first. The first player to play all of their Letter Tiles is the winner

boardgameintegration: Dungeon Storming: Il Nido di Phirion
Dungeon Storming: La Cripta di Razidar
Dungeon Storming: La Tana di Gwarl
Dungeon Storming: Il Nido di Phirion
Dungeon Storming: La Cripta di Razidar
Dungeon Storming: La Tana di Gwarl
198263.description:
From the back of the box:

"Alone, in the depths of the dungeon, surrounded by monsters. A priestess and a thief fight their way trhu hideous ghoul back from the dead. Rich treasures await you, with which you can get new weapons, armor, spells and scrolls.

A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with more players by combining two or more sets of Dungeon Storming!"

The game is played by moving the miniatures of your heroes on the map, room by room, battling the monsters with a simple roll of a die, dodging the traps, collecting treasures and magic objects, until the heroes reach the last room and try to overcome the boss monster (the heroes can exit the dungeon and buy new objects with the money found).

The map and the layout of the rooms for this dungeon are fixed (all the tables for the encounters, treasures and magical objects are printed on it), but it can be played with four levels of difficulty.

____________________________________________

From the publisher (Italian):

Quarto capitolo di Dungeon Storming, il gioco da tavolo d'avventura che vi permetterà di vivere le emozioni di un dungeon crawler in modo tascabile! La Torre di Kunrat è luogo dove il potente stregone lich estende il suo dominio sulle lande ghiacciate, al comando di un'orda di temibili scheletri. Nei panni di una Barda e di un valoroso Paladino dovrete tentare di porre fine al lugubre regno del lich Kunrat, senza che questo vi utilizzi per infoltire le sue schiere di non morti.

Esplora corridoi e stanze, trova oro e tesori e scappa prima di essere sconfitto! Arrivando al villaggio potrai compare armi e incantesimi per tornare all'avventura ancora più forte, e avvicinarti al terribile mostro finale... e forse riuscirai persino a sconfiggerlo!

Giocate questa avventura stand alone o combinate il dungeon di questo capitolo con gli altri 3 per dar vita ad un'avventura ancora più epica! Gli eroi di ciascun capitolo sono utilizzabili in ogni altro, si tratta di un gioco duro, modulare, che in ogni set presenta miniature e schede di due Avventurieri con poteri e abilità peculiari, di mostri piccoli e di un grosso mostro finale, oltre a una “vera” mappa, un emporio con oggetti unici e una missione tematica!

ATTENZIONE: le miniature all'interno non sono dipinte.
198263.name: Dungeon Storming: La Torre di Kunrat

198264.name: Die Jagd nach dem verschollenen Schatz
198264.description:
A pirate & treasure game with stamps for 2 to 4 players aged 6 years and up.
Each player picks out a pirate.
The game sheet is torn from the game pad, crumpled up and smoothed out again, so that it is wild and weavy as the sea. 10 treasures are placed onto the game sheet using the treasure chest stamp and the gold ink pad.
The game is played in turns in a clockwise direction. On your turn, put the die onto the game sheet. Cover it with the dice cup so that you can no longer see the die. Now raise the dice cup slightly and push it over the game sheet like a ship on water and stop at a free treasure of your choice. Carefully lift up the dice cup and see what is on the die:
Saber: You can keep the treasure! Stamp your pirate stamp onto the treasure. It now belongs to you and no one else can ever steel it.
Jolly Roger (pirate flag): The black pirate has struck and stolen the treasure! Take the Jolly Roger stamp and the black ink pad and stamp the treasure out. It is now lost for everyone.
Treasure chest: Take the treasure chest stamp and the gold ink pad and stamp another treasure chest on any free space of the game sheet.
The game is over as soon as all treasure chests have been stamped. The player with the most treasure chests wins. There can be more than one winner.

198266.name: Quarries of Scred
198266.description:
Quarries of Scred harkens back to a simple arcade style - dig down, collect different minerals and dirt ore and return to cash in! Strategic use of lasers, land mines and self-destruction will ensure access to hard to reach areas, though care must be taken at all times within... the Quarries of Scred!

Source: The Game Website.

198267.name: Yes, Sir!
198267.description:
A game of silly happenstances and goodwill. It is heavily influenced by P.G. Wodehouse's Bertie and Jeeves series.

(Intro of the game)

198268.name: Fort Meow
198268.description:
Fort Meow is a pillow fort physics-based puzzle adventure involving cats, destruction and a dusty old manor.

Upon finding her grandfather’s journal in the attic, Nia is attacked by a barrage of feline assailants. It seems that her grandmother has become a crazy cat lady since last time she visited, so you will need to defend Nia by building a protective fort out of furniture to keep the cats at bay, while deciphering the mysterious tales hidden within the journal.

Key Features

Physics-based pillow fort building - ​build your own custom pillow fort out of household items to protect you from an onslaught of feline assailants as they tumble and claw their way through.
Just be careful that your carefully constructed walls don’t tumble down with them.

A Cat-alogue of items to build your fort - ​build and layer your forts with pillows, grandfather clocks, toasters and more. There are over twenty items to discover, each with a unique property that will help you build the ultimate fortress of protection from the oncoming cat-aclysm.

Unravel the mystery - ​find out what brought so many cats to the attic, and what your grandfather was hiding in the pages of his journal. Something cat-astrophic could be afoot.

Cats, Cats, Cats - ​orange tabbies, majestic chinchillas, dreaded black cats, they are all invading the house and causing mischief. Check out their watermelon stack hats!

Source: The Game Website.

198269.name: En tu casa o donde sea
198269.description:
From the publisher (translated):
You have the power! Look the candidates, their characteristics and pecualiarities, choose who more interest you and await the revenge of the unchosen!
Win over, offer your better virtues, reveal the defects of your opponents and expect to be choosed. If nobody choses you... Take revenge!

En tu casa o donde sea ("Your place or anywhere") is a party game from 4 to 7 players, for adults, with a duration between 30 and 50 minutes. It is a game of sex and pleasure... with cards. Nobody takes their pants off!

User Summary:
How to play: The active player has to use a card of place and the other players (candidates) will use a card of position or vice versa. The canditates will offer to the active player cards with positive points like, chocolat, whip, kisses... at the same time, they will be able throw cards with negative points to the other candidates like, bad smell, plumer's crack... These cards have a marks (1, 2, -1, -2) that the active player will win or lose on the board if they decide to "make" the love to someone.
When the players "make love" they will get cards of pleasure with positive points, unless somebody throws a card to ruin their relationship. In that case nobody will get points of pleasure and the next player will be the active player.
The player with the most points (after three rounds), after adding card points and board points, will be the winner.

From the publisher (Spanish):
¡Tú tienes el poder! Observa a tus pretendientes, sus rasgos y peculiaridades, escoge al que más te interese y prepárate para la posible venganza de los no elegidos.
﻿Conquista, ofrece tus mejores cualidades, destapa los defectos de tus contrincantes y espera a ser el elegido. Si no lo eres... ¡véngate!
"En tu casa o donde sea" es un party game de 4 a 7 jugadores, para mayores de 18 años con una duración de 30 a 50 minutos. En él, los jugadores, exentos de género, buscarán tener sexo y placer... mediante cartas. ¡Qué nadie se baje los pantalones!

198270.description:
An Unofficial Cards Against Humanity expansion.

Includes 112 NEW cards (80 White cards & 32 Black cards)

Professionally printed Casino Quality Linen Finish cards, 100% compatible with Cards Against Humanity.
198270.name: Guards Against Insanity: Edition 2

198271.name: Guards Against Insanity: Edition 3
198271.description:
An Unofficial Cards Against Humanity expansion.

Includes 112 NEW cards (90 White cards & 22 Black cards)

Professionally printed Casino Quality Linen Finish cards, 100% compatible with Cards Against Humanity.

198272.name: Suuri löytöretkipeli ja Merirosvopeli
198272.description: You take the role of one of the great explorers (Polo, Kolumbus, Da Gama or Magalhães.) This is a learning game where you follow the routes and events of your characters expedition, by rolling dice and moving. You can make it more interesting by implicating the Pirate rule, where some of the players take the roles of pirates.

198273.name: Cats Abiding Horribly: Episode One – The Dirty Goblin
198273.description:
Have you played the game and expansions so many times that by now you've memorized all the possible funny combinations? Does the game simply not excite you like it used to anymore? Or perhaps you're just looking for something a little bit different?

If any of this sounds familiar to you then Cats Abiding Horribly is exactly what you need.

Revitalize your games with 150 new, uncensored, unofficial and anti-politically-correct cards. The deck contains 110 white, 40 black + 10 blank bonus cards that mix in seamlessly with the original game and expansions.

Printed on high-quality casino cardstock with a linen finish, you are guaranteed to enjoy this expansion for a very long time.

198274.name: Blankr: An Awkwardly Hilarious Card Game For ★★★★★
198274.description:
From the publisher:

Are you sad? Do you have no friends? Perhaps your partner left you because you have no sense of humour. Maybe no one comes to your parties because, quite frankly, they are incredibly boring. Are you a loner? Are you finding it difficult to impress someone with your pathetic attempt at trying to be funny? Are you relying on the old "knock Knock" jokes. Lord have mercy! Well don't worry boring person... Help is here! BLANKR is an awkwardly hilarious card game that will get the whole party roaring with laughter. When you see people trying to escape through windows to flee boredom, just pull out BLANKR and see those lips smile again. Bringing a new twist to the 'complete the sentence' game, Blankr encourages players to think and write down the most awkward and ridiculously funny sentences. The rules are simple, one player reads out a Blankr sentence containing a blank and the others think of a word or phrase to fill in the blank. At the end of each round all the answers are read out aloud and the funniest answer wins a point (actually lets make that 3,873,093 points). Don't worry if you're low on wit and/or lack a sense of humour as the references cards contain over 330+ weird and wonderful ideas to get your brain juices flowing. See your friends and family curl their toes and chuckle as they read out the answers. Perfect-size travel box to put into your bag or back-pocket. Perfect for girls night, boys night, girls and boys night, university game, ice breakers, drinking game etc.. Get yours now! Get some friends! Everyone is enjoying it, about time you did too. BLANKR: An Awkwardly Hilarious Card Game for ★★★★★ ****************************** A great and hilarious game!!!!! **********************************

198275.name: Segeln
198275.description: Each player is trying to reach the goal as quickly as possible. The route takes around two turning points. But beware , there are many places where it is temporarily completely windless.

198277.name: Munchkin Monster Box
198277.description: The Munchkin Monster Box has room for two thousand Munchkin cards, various Kill-O-Meters, a Level Playing Field or two, Dungeons, Seals, and more. To get you started, it includes six reprinted Munchkin promotional bookmarks and ten reprinted Munchkin promo cards.

198278.name: Green Dragon
198278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Follow these seven strangers as they come together for a singular purpose. But, is there something sinister going on behind all of this? What is to become of these masterless warriors? What does it all have to do with these powerful artifacts?

And, who is (or, who are) the mysterious benefactor(s)??

SORYU!

What happens when a fisherman, and father, is empowered by a mysterious jade dragon pendant and then has to face a demon-faced mystical villain to save his family & village...? Well, only you can decide this outcome.

198280.description:
Morphogea is a modular map expansion for Power Grid, which provides some 275 quadrillion map configurations — a number which excludes bottlenecks and peninsulas and any configuration with excess cities — via 14 individually configurable map hexes. If the players agree to peninsulas and/or bottlenecks, there are septillions of configurations — nonillions if the players agree to cover unavailable cities as in the base game.

The map hexes are "sliced" into equilateral triangles, so that connections pointing off the edge of the map can be removed by flipping over the edge triangles. Additionally, the connection costs were determined according to the first-edition Funkenschlag rules, based on the terrain the connections traverse.

Because the base game's gameboard is no longer required for the map, this expansion includes an octagonal board to replace the resource market, heptagonal boards to provide distinct city connection tracks for the different player counts, and a hexagonal turn order / auction status track.

Finally, to provide extra variety, the expansion includes a deck of 32 resource cards, which can be used to randomize the starting resource market.
198280.name: Morphogea: a modular hex map for Power Grid (Fan expansion to Power Grid)

198281.name: 101 3rd Level Spells (5E)
198281.description:
From publisher blurb:

Never Cast the Same Spell Twice!

101 Third Level Spells gives you – yes, you guessed it – 101 3rd level spells, that will help you realize the vision you’ve had for your spellcaster.

From spells that restrain and squeeze your opponent with bands of force, to a curses that changes the attributes and features of an oppnent every day with curse of chaos, or transform you opponent's weapon into a venemous nake with holding the viper! 101 Third Level Spells brings a host of new special effects to your character’s spellbook.

Wholly compatible with the 5th Edition of the World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game, 101 Third Level Level Spells adds new agonizing choices to the creation of your character’s spell list without breaking the game.

198282.name: Brimling Character Class
198282.description:
From publisher blurb:

"He Who Feeds Me, Leads Me."

Brimling brings freebooting fun to your White Star campaign. These diminuitive space pirates ply the stars in search of the greatest plunder in the galaxy: a fine meal. Pint-sized swashbucklers wielding Star Swords stand at the helm of exotic open-decked Star Galleons, eager for adventure, excitement, and a buffet of trouble!

Brimling introduces a new character class to White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying. In addition to a full seven-level class, these pages also provide detailed information on new equipment, a new ship, and new ship modifications.

198283.name: Primal Paths: A Folio of Options for Barbarians
198283.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eight new primal path options for your 5th edition barbarian:

The opportunistic Corsair
The destructive Elemental Havoc
The haunted Ghost-Ridden
The indestructible Juggernaut
The powerful Mauler
The animalistic Shifter
The predatory Stalker
The eldritch Wylder

198284.name: Kaerwyn Krune
198284.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nemesis NPCs – Kaerwyn Krune is a neutral evil male drow with hunter levels utilizing the verminous hunter archetype. His vermin companion is a giant spider, and he specializes in summoning spiders, utilizing poison, and taking advantage of teamwork feats paired with his companion.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a fearsome foe at all levels, 1 thru 20! This allows you to easily introduce an enemy into your campaign and reintroduce the same enemy at any time with no prior preparation. Simply find the appropriate challenge rating and go. The NPC advances along with your players with no work on your part.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Nemesis NPCs series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new nemesis today!

198285.name: Pathogen (Supers!)
198285.description:
From publisher blurb:

It could be anyone. It could takeover anything it touches. Can your heroes stop Pathogen, the living virus? This release includes a NEW BOOST usable with SUPERS! Revised Edition!

198286.name: Stellar 2D
198286.description:
Stellar 2D is a 2d retro-arcade space shooter space game, where you can destroy a lot of asteroids and enemies trying to save the planet Astreal 3 from the invasion of the Zurin’Kai alien race.

Source: The Game Website.

198287.description:
On returning from the far north, the heroes find a devastated Andor. Conquered by the Krahder from the south and their skeleton army, many Andori were enslaved and abducted by them. The heroes are the last hope for the kingdom.

Die Legenden von Andor: Die letzte Hoffnung, the sequel to Legends of Andor, includes a new map of the southern regions of Andor, new legends, and more.
198287.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die letzte Hoffnung
boardgameaccessory: Die Legenden von Andor: Die Feinde von Andor

198288.name: Hearts of Chaos (5E)
198288.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amethyst is a Role Playing Game presenting a world where a true-to-book fantasy setting is forced upon our real world. How would humanity respond? This is not some stylized view of Earth seen in books and on TV. It’s a world with all the problems, both social and political, intact.

Five hundred years after magic’s return, the remnants of our technological heritage live in the few remaining bastions—cities like ones of present day, but walled in against the encroaching magic surrounding it.

Will mankind be able to retake the planet and push the fantasy back into the realms of our imagination, able to resume our bind passion for consumerism and industrialization? Is this world better than the one mankind squandered?

Hearts of Chaos is an introductory module for Amethyst. It includes new rules and pregenerated characters for those wanting to get right into the action. It also presents an overview of Amethyst's 5E adaptation for those curious of the larger production.
The players take the role of members of an international techan mercenary company tasked with a critical mission: Venture into a no-man’s land where few humans have been, find a rogue former colonel in lie with those born of magic, and kill him.

This adventure includes:

Six Pregenerated characters
All the basic rules from Amethyst required for play using 5th Edition rules.
Monsters unique to the Amethyst setting.
5th Edition rules to add technology to any game.

198289.name: The Shade
198289.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ambition, desperation, or just a tragic past or the main common reasons why a creature has become a shade. Shades devour darkness by killing their opponents or by simply absorbing it, which they use to fuel their dark powers. A shade can be from any humanoid race and they look like a member of such race but with dark, whispy skin tones and glowing eyes. No matter what their backgrounds are, shades are the masters of shadows.

This product contains two files:

A 13 page playbook containing over 25 moves, and 7 magic items.
A two page character sheet for you to record your character's stats, gear, and moves.

198290.name: Boston Crawl
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
198290.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bang out and ship up to Boston!

Ladies and gentleman, it’s the game that turns brass dragons green with envy, Maximum Xcrawl! Powered by the mighty Pathfinder gaming engine, Xcrawl is where dungeon hack and slash goes prime time and sells advertising space on the cooling corpses of your enemies.

The BostonCrawl is the first full-lethal event of its kind to be held in Beantown, and the locals are taking it very seriously. Get ready for DJ Molly Militia's undead redcoats, the Hockey Stick of Doom, and a creature that is equal parts devastatingly dangerous and wicked refreshing – the beer golem!

This edition has been converted to the DCC RPG rules set.

198291.name: Hyper Kawaii 3
198291.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kawaii vs. Kaiju!

Sakura, Setsuko, and Shigeko (PL 10) lead normal, teenaged, kaiju-smashing lives. Their father, Professor Nakano, injected them with meta serum to save their lives, and now they use their considerable powers for good ... and to get through the drama of high school.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

198292.name: Escape Machines
198292.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Escape Machines is an addictive Science Fiction single/multiplayer adventure shooter in the near future! Artificial intellect and robots fight against their creators. You must take control of the robots and save people.

Game features:
- Play with friends in co-op and VS multi-player.
- Build robots and command them to win in battle.
- Upgrade your weapons and armour.
- Battle huge robot bosses.
- Use vehicles to travel, add turrets to your vehicles.

Source: The Game Website.

198293.name: Celestial
198293.description:
From publisher blurb:

Up and Away!

Celestial is an alien of mixed heritage with vast powers that could turn him into a nearly unstoppable tyrant. But he was raised in a simple farm life by parents who loved him, and imbued in him a strong sense of right and wrong.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

198294.name: Comedic Character Options
198294.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Adventure…

In conjunction with d20PFSRD.com and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen bring you their latest release!

Sometimes, a game isn’t designed to be the most serious and dramatic of activities. Sometimes, we all just want a laugh. And when the Four Horsemen laugh, it’s usually too late!

Want some key rules to help get a giggle out of your group? How about the archetypes for the Prankster? It has a pie color-and-effect table for prankster antics.

Or feats such as “Just Swing That Anywhere” and “Please Stop Helping.” Or the spells bull’s grace, rubber chicken, and vuvuzela.

Sound silly? Good!

198295.description:
In Colours and Shapes players take on the role of one of the eight colours and shapes:

Red Triangle; Orange Oval; Yellow Line; Green Square; Blue Circle; Indigo Diamond; Violet Rectangle; or Grey.

Each has their own special power creating a unique gameplay experience. Battle friends in this match making card game and learn your colours and shapes!

The base game of Colours and Shapes is an exciting 2-4 player game that can either be played in minutes, or for hours, requiring you to combine thoughtful strategy, luck, and in-your-face gameplay to create a fun, fast, and casual game that can be played anywhere, anytime.

Players decide whether to lay down sets of at least three of a kind, or push their luck to wait and lay down more than three. However, if they wait too long and get caught with cards, each one is -2 points. After playing certain sets, players may activate extra powers that stop their opponents from winning or help them move a step closer to victory.
198295.name: Colours and Shapes

rpgitemversion: Crisis on Ulthar One PDF Version
Krise auf Ulthar Eins PDF Version
198296.name: Krise auf Ulthar Eins
198296.description:
Ein cthuloides Science-Fiction-Abenteuer

User summary:

This German-language Cthulhu-horror, Space Opera adventure is system neutral. It requires the player characters be bridge officers on a powerful military spaceship with substantive resources and capabilities. In the adventure, the ship is ordered to investigate Ulthar, a world seeking admittance to the same "federation" to which the players' ship belongs. Rumors have circulated that something is wrong at Ulthar.

The adventure also is offered in English.

198297.name: I Loot the Cleric's Body
198297.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers are always looting the bodies of their vanquished foes. Often the GM simply reads off the villain’s equipment list and the players move on. In this situation, beyond armour, weapons, magic items and some coin most foes never seem to carry anything of minor interest. This doesn’t help the GM diligently trying to breathe life and verisimilitude into his campaign.

Enter I Loot the Cleric’s Body. Within, find three tables packed full of religious objects and outfits along with the random things found in a cleric’s pouch. Use them to enliven the looting in your campaign today!

198298.name: I Loot the Cleric's Body
198298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers are always looting the bodies of their vanquished foes. Often the GM simply reads off the villain’s equipment list and the players move on. In this situation, beyond armour, weapons, magic items and some coin most foes never seem to carry anything of minor interest. This doesn’t help the GM diligently trying to breathe life and verisimilitude into his campaign.

Enter I Loot the Cleric’s Body. Within, find three tables packed full of religious objects and outfits along with the random things found in a cleric’s pouch. Use them to enliven the looting in your campaign today!

198299.name: The Throne of Thorns
198299.description:
Campaign Overview

From the introduction:

SPOILER ALERT!
This document contains numerous revelations regarding the Chronicle of the Throne of Thorns and is written for Game Masters only. If you plan to experience the chronicle as a player you really shouldn’t continue past this sentence.
...
The barbarian legend...gives voice to an allegory describing the basic design of the world. The barbarians have borne witness to battles between the three principles of the legend, and have again and again been victimized by the aftereffects of such conflicts.

198300.name: The Toxicologist (Hybrid Class)
198300.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seeking to build a Hulking character? No longer desiring to Hyde in the darkness? This issue of the Player Paraphernalia series offers the Toxicologist, a hybrid class based on the alchemist and monk. So if you want to improve your combat prowess through better chemistry, check out the Toxicologist!

198301.name: White Room
198301.description:
From publisher blurb:

They put the ESP in Espionage… White Room!

A Renegade Organization, White Room is a mysterious intelligence agency composed of individuals with unique gifts. White Room is an iconic setting element in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

White Room’s file has no color or ranking designation, because the organization may be composed of people of hugely diverse backgrounds. In fact, the membership of the organization is left largely vacant, for the GM to fill with characters tailor-made to their players. The two feature agents of White Room detailed in this release are Mr. Ulysses and Ms. D. These two mysterious characters are PL 11 and 9, respectively, each offering a distinctive set of psychic skills with which they serve the interests of White Room. What are those interests? Will the players find themselves targets of this mysterious espionage group, or will they fight side by side? Only time, and serious investigation, will tell!

198302.name: Feats of Elementalism
198302.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a two pages of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Elementalism includes eight new feats for enthusiasts of psychic and kinetic combat options: Earthly Advantage, Elemental Versatility, Fiery Force, Four Winds Defense, Gather Concentration, Kinetic Reserve, Roiling Force, and Wrathful Flames!

198303.name: Catfolk
198303.description:
From publisher blurb:

Astonishing Races: Catfolk gives the catfolk a full-racial review and expansion, emulating the style of the “Core Races“ as detailed in books like the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide and others.

Astonishing Races: Catfolk aims to give players of dexterous and agile race immersive, world-neutral materials and support for almost any kind of play. Included are new and expanded options for alternate racial traits and subtypes, favored class options for all the base, core, hybrid, and occult classes, and three racial archetypes.

The book also has new racial rules for catfolk equipment, feats, traits, magic items, spells and more!

So if you’ve ever wanted to play a Savannah Stalker or Swift Savage, whip out your Claw Blades, or perhaps use your Feral Fury feat, then Astonishing Races: Catfolk is the book for you!

198304.name: Unhinge the Mind
198304.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Madness for Shadow of the Demon Lord!

Unhinge the Mind expands the existing Insanity and madness rules so they become a considerable part of the game, with far-reaching consequences for those who would confront the monstrous and grotesque. The optional rules presented here increase the amount of Insanity gained, make getting rid of Insanity more difficult, and provide a wide range of new consequences for going mad, including short-term and long-term madness. Using the rules in this Poisoned Pages entry will drive your player characters crazy!

198305.name: Bandits on Mars
198305.description:
From the publisher:
Bounty hunters, welcome to Mars, your occasion to make a bounce of money is standing right in front of your eyes!
In Bandits on Mars you will play the role of smart gunners hunting cyber bandits that are hiding inside Woodburg's Wild West Theme Park. To get them, broken or alive, you can count exclusively on your feline reflex and on the eye of the finest sniper in Mars, in addition with a good memory.

The bandits will try to hide them self as soon as they have a chance, coming back in the open only for a nice royal rumble. Use at best the sheriff's help, hoping that he won't be charmed by the beautiful saloon's dancers, while the bandits that you chase down try to escape riding their rocket bull.

Bandits on Mars is a game of dexterity and memory that links your ability in chasing the right bandits at the right time with the ability to remember where they are hidden.

198306.name: Something Wicker This Way Comes
198306.description:
Conflicts are only natural...

From the introduction:

The druids of the Feyindir Forest and the villagers of Spiralle have always maintained a peaceful, if uneasy, relationship. But now trouble is brewing. Villagers are going missing in the forest, and druids are being murdered in response. The terms of peace between the two parties has been shattered, and now the druids are threatening to unleash one of the most fearsome manifestations of druidic vengeance known. Can the PCs step in to restore peace to the land?

User summary:

For a party of four adventurers of 7th level

198307.name: Egos (2013)
198307.description:
User summary:

In this rules-light game, the group collaboratively creates a number of characters - half super-heroes, half super-villains - that are interesting to everyone. The group creates a number of characters one less than the number of players, then adds a "civilian" (non-super) character sheet. The character sheets are then randomly and secretly distributed to the players. Play then involves players trying to determine which players have which characters, before a final hero-vs-villain showdown.

198308.name: Otus Mekanikus
198308.description:
From publisher blurb:

Otus Mekanikus on lisäosa Astraterra-seikkailuroolipeliin ja esittelee lisää erilaisia olentoja ja nimenomaan erilaisia keinotekoisia otuksia, kuten elokoneita, villikoneita ja erilaisia laboratorioiden luomuksia.
Astraterran Olentopediasta löytyy pari erilaista elokonetta ja siellä myös kerrottiin jonkin verran niiden alkuperästä ja toiminnasta. Otus Mekanikuksessa esitellään lisää uusia elokoneita ja avataan seikkaperäisemmin niiden historian hämäriin unohtuneita taustoja sekä teknistä rakennetta.

Villikoneet ovat elokoneita ja muita elokoneiden kaltaisia rakennelmia, jotka ovat kehittäneet oman tahdon ja elävät itsenäisesti kukin omalla tavallaan.

Laboratorioiden luomukset puolestaan ovat erilaisia keinotekoisia kummajaisia. Pitkään vain muinaiset ovat hallinneet keinotekoisen älyn ja elämän luomisen, mutta nyt nerokkaimmat, hulluimmat ja uskaliaimmat keksijät ja masinologit ovat onnistuneet hautomaan kasvuliemisammioissaan keinotekoisia olentoja, joita kutsutaan klonteiksi sekä luomaan puolikoneita istuttamalla mekaanisia osia eläviin olentoihin.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Otus Mekanikus is an add-Astra Terra-adventure role-playing game and introduces more variety of creatures and specifically for different types of artificial creatures, such as elokoneita, wild machines and a variety of laboratory creations.
Astraterran Olentopediasta can be found in a couple of different elokonetta and there was also told some of their origin and operation. Otus Mekanikuksessa introduces more new elokoneita and opened detail of their history forgotten in shady backgrounds, as well as the technical structure.

Wild machines are elokoneita elokoneiden and other similar structures which have developed their own will and live independently in their own way.

Laboratory creations , in turn, have a variety of artificial freaks. Only the most ancient are dominated by artificial intelligence and the creation of life, but now the most brilliant, the craziest and daring inventors and masinologit have succeeded in searches for your kasvuliemisammioissaan artificial creatures, which are called klonteiksi, as well as to create a semi-planting machines mechanical parts of living beings.

198309.name: Javelin Class Torpedo Boat
198309.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a 300dT torpedo boat.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

198310.name: Extraction from Earth
198310.description:
User summary:

Character creation involves selecting several "Values" (somewhat like a fusion of Attributes and Skills in more typical roleplaying games). Values will vary between characters. Values have points distributed form a pool. Action resolution involves a modified die roll compared to a target number.

198311.name: Apple Pop
198311.description:
Pop the apple out of the tree. Win by collecting the correct three!

Kids dexterity game.

198312.name: The Prisoner Game
198312.description:
This is a game about communication without language. It is played in complete silence.

User summary:

This intriguing and peculiar game is played entirely in silence. Furthermore, only the game master is allowed to write and pass notes. Many of these notes are provided in the game text for print-and-play use. The game presents a single scenario that incorporates the well-known game-theory problem of "the prisoner's dilemma". The rules suggest a post-game (verbal) analysis by the participants.

Note the game was an anonymous contribution to the Game Chef 2013 competition.

198314.name: Moral Choice
198314.description:
User summary:

Moral Choice is a philosophical game published in Canada in 1985 by Moral Choice Associates.

In the game 2-6 players move around a spiral track representing their growth from childhood to adulthood to old age by rolling a die. Most of the squares have a large K or M on them in five different colours. There are also special Horseshoe (Opportunity), Lightning Bolt (Crisis), Light Bulb (Bright Idea) and Superdilemma squares.

When they land on K or M square, they must choose a card of the colour they landed on from a box divided into 18 groups. These cards describe moral dilemmas (brief case studies) on one side, with four multiple-choice options and the real solutions for both the K and M philosophies on the other.

These cards are divided into three major categories based on age (Youth, Adult and Senior), each of which is divided into six colour-coded sub-categories based on the type of dilemma one must solve (Business/Professional, Biomedical, Social/Political, Environmental, Personal/Sexual, Superdilemmas).

The K squares ask players to answer a dilemma according to the duty-based ethics of Immanuel Kant. The M squares ask you to solve the same dilemma according to the utilitarian ethics of John Stuart Mill. The game comes with summary cards for Kant and Mill listing their seven key ideas in each case.

Players can use either the easy multiple-choice option, or answer the dilemma in their own words, with the other players voting on how close they came to matching the true solution. In the case of a Superdilemma, no solutions are given, so players propose their own, with others voting to determine whether it’s correct. They can also time the game, giving each player 3-5 minutes to answer a dilemma.

If you get the right answer, they can move forward next turn. If they get it wrong, they move backwards when they roll again. The winner is the first player who gets to the end of the spiral track.

198315.name: The Golden Bones of Lightwatch Tower
198315.description:
From the introduction:

Orlin Swift was a bard of no small reputation, who traveled the Azurewood seeking quests and adventures. He recently took on a commission from the Rhengar Adventurers’ Guild far to the east of the wood, to deliver a map to the chieftain of a desert tribesman in exchange for a map of the oases which allowed the tribes to cross the desert. While staying at The Coach, Orlin was told of the disappearance of Delb’s son by the broken-hearted innkeeper.

User summary:

For 3-5 characters of 1st - 2nd level

198316.name: Valley
198316.description:
Explore the vast and beautiful world of Valley using the power of the L.E.A.F. SUIT: a fierce exoskeleton that grants exceptional speed and agility along with the phenomenal ability to manipulate the life and death of all living things.

Source: The Game Website.

198317.name: The Crystalline Caves of Black Leaf Forest
198317.description:
From the introduction:

In the Crystalline Caves of Black Leaf Forest there is an entrance to the dark elf city of Ithilanx, a city radiant with precious gems and minerals far beneath the earth. The entrance is a set of gold double doors that have magical writing on them, and it is protected by drow of the House of Imazress, a dark elf house of Ithilanx. The magical writing describes how to open the gold double doors, and beyond them is a tunnel that is miles and miles long that goes to the dark elf city of Ithilanx.

198318.name: Hexcrawling: Wilderness Exploration & Random Encounters
198318.description:
Wilderness exploration and random encounters

From the introduction:

[These] optional rules expand the Getting Lost section in the Wilderness rules (Dungeon Master’s Guide p. 106-112) and Random Encounter checks (p. 86), providing more opportunities for the player characters to interact with wilderness exploration.

198324.name: Rail Raiders Infinite: Old Tyme Religion
198324.description:
Old Tyme Religion is an expansion to Rail Raiders Infinite, raising the player limit to 6.

The expansion includes 2 new Raiders (Dr. Umbra PhD, Mutha Superior), 6 new Lawbots (3x Pallbearers, 2x Preachers, 1x 999), 4 new train car tiles (chapel car, maintenance car, 2 mortuary cars), 5 additional poker dice, and cards for each deck (High Noon, Long Arm of the Law, Raider, and Loot).

198325.description:
This Full Faction Expansion for Rum & Bones: Second Tide contains the following:

5x Iron Inquisition Hero Models
5x Hero Dashboards +1x Crew Dashboard
30x Hero Skill Cards +2x Crew Upgrade Card
24x Iron Inquisition Deckhands
6x Iron Inquisition Bosuns
1x Ship Board
5x Objective Tiles
1x Iron Inquisition Tide Deck
3x Iron Inquisition Deployment Point Tokens
Picking up the Iron Inquisition during the campaign will also get you:

1x KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE Saint Seraphina model + Dashboard/Skill Cards
198325.name: Rum & Bones: Iron Inquisition

198326.name: Rum & Bones: Fairy Tale
198326.description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive Set contains the following MERCENARY models:

(Captain) Bricktop, Porcine Leader
(Quartermaster) Mister Sticks, Dangerously Drunk
(Swashbuckler) Hayworth, Piggy Prankster
(Gunner) Red Hood, The Rum-Runner Maiden
(Brute) Big B, Alpha Hunter

198327.name: Pizza, Pizza!
198327.description:
Make a perfect pizza but do beware, there could be a slug or bug under there!

A fun colour and shape matching game, but unlike a traditional pizza, the toppings in this game are sometimes very unusual and yukky, which children find hilarious.

Make a delicious pizza by matching colours and shapes with the help of the Head Chef. Beware of yucky toppings and other players who want to swipe your slices!

198328.name: Clue: Game of Thrones
198328.description:
Description from the publisher:

High treachery and betrayal are behind the two mysteries to solve in Clue: Game of Thrones.

Thanks to the double-sided game board, players can choose to solve the murder mystery in The Red Keep or in Meereen. WHO was responsible for plotting the murder? WHAT weapon was used and WHERE did the crime take place?

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
198329.name: The Halls of Lidless Shabbath
198329.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Halls of Lidless Shabbath is an OSRIC(tm) module designed for 4-6 adventurers of levels 12-15.

Rolled into a yard-tall, ivory scroll tube, the worn charcoal rubbing of a giant map etched into an ancient monolith hints that travel between worlds was once easy. More enticingly, the map pinpoints the entrance to the eldritch pathway. The crude rubbing shows nothing but the location of the ancient and legendary dungeon known as the Halls of Lidless Shabbath!

The Halls are the home of the evil sorceress Shabbath. She was famed for having researched many new spells and created many unique magic items, as well as possessing fantastic treasures of gold and jewels, and the caves are also suspected to be a nexus of the planes. Little about the contents of the Halls themselves is known, save that Shabbath is rumored still to be alive, the Halls are reputedly haunted by demons, and a large warband or small army of trolls has been seen thereabouts.

198330.name: Scrambled Slogans
198330.description:
Subtitled "The New Adult Game that Peps up the Party - Smart - Saucy - Sophisticated", Scrambled Slogans consists of six pads (labeled A-F) of perforated and gummed labels. Each pad contains 48 phrases or sayings, such as "Red-headed woman suspected", "Down on the farm", "No metal can touch you", and "What a Young Girl Ought to Know".

The game also includes a pad of blank sheets. Each player or team then takes one or more of the gummed sheets and attempts to write a funny story, using as many as possible of the gummed phrases. The players are allowed to bridge gaps by hand writing any names of people or places, pronouns, prepositions such as in, at, of, on, for, to, etc. as well as a dozen common verbs: be, do, go, can, say, have, see, meet, give, think, know, hear.

After the stories have been completed, each is read aloud and a winner is chosen either by the hostess or by a vote of the players.

rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
198331.name: Morts
198331.description:
From publisher blurb:

The zombie apocalypse was rough, but that was, like, a hundred years ago. It’s time to move on already.

Zombies, lich kings, ghosts…they’re a reality now, and somebody’s got to keep them in line. But it’s not a dream job. More like the last refuge for losers and desperate teenagers in need of a little cash. You’re a Mortician or "Mort," facing down the undead for minimum wage and possibly getting eaten in the process. Training’s overrated, but you do get a shotgun, a couple of chintzy ritual components, and a chewed-up leather jacket.

Protect humanity from the undead hordes in this Fate World of Adventure by Ed Turner.

Morts requires Fate Core to play. This 46-page supplement includes:

Extensive information about the post-apocalypse world in the new country of Cascadia, including plenty of locations and threats to populate a campaign
Simple generation rules for the undead in Fate Core as adversaries, NPCs, and PCs and system ideas for necromantic spells and rituals
A step-by-step mission creation system to aid GMs
A complete adventure: Randolph the Lich King




Cascadia needs you! Join the Morticians!

198332.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 552)
198332.description:
Storytelling Tip: Make Knowledge Checks Seamless And Engaging

New Contest: 100 Road Encounters

198333.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 553)
198333.description: The Secrets to Successful Long-Term Campaigns

198334.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 554)
198334.description:
Bringing Swamps to Life - Part 1

Reader Tip Request: How To Handle My Three Difficult Players

Brief Word From Johnn

198335.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 555)
198335.description:
10 Intriguing Swamp Encounters

Reader Tip Request: How to handle a player with dyslexia?

A Brief Word From Johnn

198337.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 557)
198337.description:
10 Keys to Suspenseful Adventures

Reader Tip Request: How do you create World Wonders for your world?

Reader Tips

198338.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 558)
198338.description:
The Comic, the Diva and the Stump: How to Handle Difficult and Apathetic Players

Reader Tip Request: Mage - Umbral Encounters

10 Tips to Resolve Group Conflicts: A professional counselor gives game-specific advice

198339.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 559)
198339.description: What initiative tips, systems and props do you use?

198340.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 560)
198340.description:
5 Ways To Foil Your Players

Brief Word From Johnn

198341.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 561)
198341.description: Do You Take It Easy On The New Guy?

198342.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 562)
198342.description:
