How to Create Your Own World Wonders

Boring doesn't cut it in your games. Mundane don't entertain. Only things that stand out will get - and keep - player attention. Plus, boring things are hard to craft stories around. You need special people, places and things as ingredients to craft superior adventures.

198343.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 563)
198343.description: 5 Ways To Breathe New Life Into Your Campaign

198344.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 564)
198344.description: How do you create wonders for your world? (revisited)

198347.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 567)
198347.description: 25 Ways to Think Faster on Your Feet

198348.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 568)
198348.description:
Brief Word From Johnn
Getting Organized For A New Campaign
Software and Tools I've Picked to Stay Sane While Running "Chalice"
Signup For Free Course On Campaign Organization

198349.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 569)
198349.description:
Brief Word From Johnn
The Productive GM: The 5 Buckets of Sanity - Part 1

198350.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 570)
198350.description:
Brief Word From Johnn
The Productive GM: The 5 Buckets of Sanity - Part 2

198351.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 571)
198351.description: How to Create Religions for Your Game World

198352.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 572)
198352.description: 7 Tips On Creating Awesome Encounters On The Fly

198353.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 573)
198353.description: What is the Bullseye Design Method? Three Wins in One!

198354.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 574)
198354.description: Get Serious: 5 Ways to Add Gravitas to Your Game

198355.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 575)
198355.description:
The 3 Line NPC Method - How to create story-full NPCs fast

User summary:

Issue 575 was published in two parts (575 A & 575 B); they are related in topic and theme.

198356.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 576)
198356.description: Some great NPC tips and links for you

198357.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 577)
198357.description: Villain Plot Design Reversal: This Technique Will Make You Look Like an Evil Genius

198358.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 578)
198358.description: 9 Tips On How To Add Conspiracies To Your Game

198359.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 579)
198359.description: Top 11 Ways to Get the Most Out of Your Player's Background

198361.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 581)
198361.description: The First 15 - A Key GM Technique For Great Game Sessions

198362.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 582)
198362.description: 17 Tips On Handling Split Parties Well

198363.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 583)
198363.description: 10 Skills To Help At The Table

198365.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 585)
198365.description: World Building - 7 Tips For Designing A World You Love

198367.name: Soda Drinker Pro
198367.description:
The world's most advanced soda drinking simulator. Soda Drinker Pro contains a secret game titled Vivian Clark that can be accessed during gameplay by standing next to a particular rock for over thirty seconds. Vivian Clark has been compared to Wario Ware, LSD: Dream Emulator, and other abstract games.

Source: The Game Website.

198368.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 586)
198368.description: Eight Tips For Using Real World Locations In Your Games

198369.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 587)
198369.description: 10 Tips To Stop Nerves Before GMing

198371.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 589)
198371.description: Tips For Running A Scarier Horror Game

198372.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 590)
198372.description: Mailbag - Problem player, magic items too powerful, GMing after an absence

198374.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 592)
198374.description: Teamwork Tips and Munchkin Item Tips

198375.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 593)
198375.description: How to Create Story-Exploding Character Hooks

198376.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 594)
198376.description: How to Kick Mad Max's Ass AKA Challenging Players Who Have Optimized Characters

198377.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 595)
198377.description:
CONTENTS:

--> A Brief Word From Johnn
--> Feature: Venger's Best Adventure Writing Tips
--> Scrolls of Wisdom
--> Gems of the Week

198378.name: Diminutives Opposing Civilization
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 71: Friday, September 30th
The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 72: Monday, October 3rd
198378.description:
Rude, rambunctious, and raunchy. Diminutives hate civilization and they are on a one-way trip to end it all! Equipping themselves with unique and powerful gear (such as Yo Dong Wang’s Doom Frisbee and the Dreaded Unitard of the Old One) they fight while assembling their ultimate weapon of destruction. Will your diminutive be victorious and be the one to destroy it all?!

Diminutives Opposing Civilization is a card game for 3-5 players. Each player uses quality and gear cards to outfit their diminutive, defeat other diminutives, gather pieces for their ultimate weapon, and destroy civilization! There are literally millions of hilarious combinations in DOC.

If you think that Diminutives Opposing Civilization is just a straight-forward, predictable game, well… think again! DOC also has both “Twist of Fate” and “Quirk” cards. Twist of Fate cards create situations and effects that no can predict. Quirk cards shift the fate of battle in unpredictable ways.

Spontaneous and unpredictable, with just enough strategy, means that Diminutives Opposing Civilization will keep things hilariously interesting!

198379.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 596)
198379.description: How To Stop Pixel Bitching In Your Adventures

198380.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 597)
198380.description: 8 Ways To Use Time For More Interesting Gameplay

198381.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 598)
198381.description: Tips For Running Single Class Campaigns (All PCs of the same character type)

198382.name: Invasion of House Tor
198382.description:
From the introduction:

Salem is a large town run by its nobles. However, many of these nobles are corrupt. In the rule of these corrupt nobles, magic folk are being imprisoned, executed, and put to slavery for nobles.

In addition to this, no house plays fair and in fighting between the houses is a constant as they vie for power over each other.
...
The party has been contracted by the House of Tor to provide "extra security" during [an upcoming celebration].

User summary:

A "one-shot" adventure for three or four low level characters.

198383.name: The Haunting of Calrow Ruins
198383.description:
From the introduction:

Gibberlings infest Calrow Ruins. When the mists blow in off the shores of Lach Gwyren, snaking through crumbling arches and shattered barbicans, the gibberlings’ terrible wailing can be heard for miles. These leering, furry abominations are spawned from captives by an ancient brood mother lurking beneath the ruins. Once imprisoned in a magic tapestry deep within the keep, the brood mother is close to finally escaping thanks to the meddling of a vengeful lady-inwaiting. Amidst a noble feud to reclaim the ruins, the characters are faced with solving the mystery of the gibberlings.

User summary:

For four to five characters of grade 5.

198384.name: Reinos e Relíquias
198384.description:
Reinos e Relíquias is a fantasy card game in which players take the role of a hero from one of three kingdoms (Light, Darkness and Neutral) trying to defeat heroes from other kingdoms and, by doing so, stealing relics to his kingdoms. Players can equip new itens, cast powerfull spells and recruit new allies playing cards from their hands. Each weapon/spell has a different range and power and, if the defending player does not evade or absorb the damage by using his armor, he subtracts his hitpoints. When a player reaches zero life, the attacking player takes one relic from the pile and one from the defeated player.
When all the relics are gathered, the players score relics for their kingdoms (based on the value for that particular kingdom printed on each relic card). The players with the most points (in other words, the kingdom with the most points) at the end, shares the victory.

198385.name: Tip the Scales
198385.description:
Tip the Scales tests your knowledge and luck against your opponent to tip the scales in your favour.

Your superior knowledge about diet, exercise and other lifestyle issues will get your scales tipping quickly.

Game consists of general knowledge about diet and exercise, activities or positive and negative actions that increase or reduce the weight on your scales.

198386.name: Jippijaja Quiz
198386.description: Jippijaja Quiz is a party game with 550 questions about sport, fashion, music, history, movies and more.

198387.name: Jippijaja Quiz: Resor & Äventyr
198387.description: Jippijaja Quiz: Resor & Äventyr is a party game with 550 questions about travelling, restaurants, museums, and world-famous attractions.

198388.name: Jippijaja Quiz: Underhållning
198388.description: Jippijaja Quiz: Underhållning is a party game with 550 questions about movie heroes and Eurovision Song Contest winners, classic TV moments and books.

198389.name: KopFit
198389.description:
KopFit is a Game which includes 10 Games to sharpen your mind. It is a trainer for mental fitness.
When you play KopFit, you have to go through 10 Competitions to get points. The one with the most points at the end is the winner.
The ten games are:
WORTWECHSEL: You have to change a word into another, letter by letter in four steps.
MEMODEMO: It's a Memory-Game where you must find the cards in a given sequence.
AUF EIN WORT: You must complete letters to words.
SUMM SUMM: You must try to get the biggest or smallest amount by connecting numbers by making different calculations (+/-/x/:).
WIMMELBAR: You must try to keep objects in mind.
LETTERATUR: You must sort objects depending on their 1, 2, or 3 letters, after the cards are removed from the table.
MONOVIEL: You must find words with the same starting letter for as many categories you can manage in 30 seconds.
LÄNDERSPIEL: You have to sort countries depending on Population, size of area and inhabitants of their capitol city.
SAG SELBST: You must complete quotes in your own way.
STARKE SPRÜCHE: You must vote for quotes, and try to vote, how your opponents vote.
The points are marked with colored wooden pins into the brains of the players mats.
A counter clock, which is needed for some games is added.

198390.name: Echt jetzt?!
198390.description: Electronic Quiz-Game with Gamemaster-Console, which contents more than 1000 Questions.

198391.name: Sten, Sax, Påse: Superdueller
198391.description: Sten, Sax, Påse: Superdueller is a variation on the classic Rock, Paper, Scissors. In this game you have cards with Rocks, Scissors and Pouches (in Sweden it's not paper but pouch), that you play to win matches. But before every match you also draw and read a card with special rule for that match. It can be that more then two player gonna play, or that a player must win two times in a row. The game is played until one player has a certain amount of wins.

198392.name: A Druid's Duel
198392.description:
Welcome to the Realm of Six Seasons, where the predictable cycle of nature's seasons has turned constantly since time began. But now, something is wrong.

A bright Summer's day ends in a snowy Winter's eve. The next morning brings a burst of colorful Autumn leaves and even that is followed by a surprising deluge of Springtime rains. Something (or someone) is tampering with the precious Seasons, making a complete mess of the Realm.

The Druids of the Esoteric Orders have long fostered this fertile landscape and tended to this delicate mystical balance. And it is up to Warren, a young druid fresh from his Esoteric Training, to discover what is causing this disastrous mixing of Seasons.

A Druid's Duel is a fast-paced turn-based strategy game set in a world of Celtic lore where players can create and destroy the board by harnessing the power of nature.

A Realm of Endless Discovery

Looks can be deceiving: With a game board that changes based on players' actions, and units that each have powerful animal abilities, you'll need to stay focused and never let your guard down.

A multitude of options: Whether it's the single player story told across more than 130 levels, local play or online play for up to 4 players, there's enough variety for new and experienced players.

Nothing is random in A Druid's Duel. A simple set of rules governs the board, allowing the game to be learned quickly, with various difficulty settings to match your current ability. But at its highest difficulty expect to spend months mastering the nuances that manipulating the board can create.

Source: The Game Website.

198393.name: The Burning Tree of Coilltean Grove (Pathfinder)
198393.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four to five PCs of level 4

While travelling deep in the forest the adventurers happen upon a violent feud between two tribes of sprites vying to add a sacred grove to their own territory. While such disputes among the fey are not uncommon, it is rare for these hostilities to escalate into warfare.

Coilltean Grove is tended by a dryad caretaker named Flùràlainn. She has unsuccessfully tried to negotiate a truce between the Briarvine and Thornbranch sprite tribes – even offering to evenly divide her home between them if it would stop the war. When diplomacy failed she resorted to using force to dissuade them from their actions which prompted the sprites to set her most beloved tree ablaze.

198394.name: Dwarven Dread (Pathfinder)
198394.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four to six PCs of levels 5-6

Argyle the Betrayer was a powerful Dwarven cave wizard that was corrupted by a Derro Magister named Angree’, and is now quite insane and bent on the destruction of the surface races, most especially Dwarfs. Angree’ has subjugated Argyle using powerful hallucinogens, in addition to a number of Duergar Tyrants, and positioned Argyle as a mad savior to the Duergar. Argyle and his “servant” Angree’, as well as the Duergar, spend most days torturing Dwarfs, or calling on elementals to forge alliances to overthrow the surface dwellers.

Argyle’s complex is found miles below the surface off a well-traveled path in the Underworld. Its walls are covered in a fungus that emits an eerie green glow.

198395.name: Howling Halls (Pathfinder)
198395.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four PCs of level 7

The PCs may encounter this minidungeon as part of a larger underground complex, or they may be employed specifically by a local power in order to clear this den of undeath.

This cold stone crypt is unlit (except in the three central chambers), and only creatures with a light source or darkvision can see into its depths ; it is advisable
that the PCs keep moving – prolonged exposure to the numbing cold here will eventually lead to frostbite or hypothermia, unless the PCs are wearing warm clothing, or have access to the appropriate magic.

198396.name: The Legacy of Theft (Pathfinder)
198396.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three to five PCs of levels 6-7

The town of Ghezbaldi has stood for millennia. Recent construction work to build a new inn uncovered the entranceway to a long abandoned underground complex. The builders of the inn, Edwyn and Jackson Cairn, took it upon themselves to drop down into the dark hallways of what some say is a long forgotten thieves’ guild and explore. That was 3 days ago, and now the townsfolk are concerned.

198397.name: Mountains
198397.description:
From publisher blurb:

Davae Breon Jaxon's Cinematic Environs begins a new series of supplements designed to help GMs paint vivid cinematic scenes for their players in a way that gives the environment its own unique character.

These environs can take a mundane encounter or location and turn it into an epic scene that the players will be talking about for year to come.

This third in the series deals with Mountain Environs. It discusses the effects of altitude, falling, rock slides, cliffs and many other hazards that the characters will have to face if they are to reach the far side of the mountains in time.

Now, instead of simply sending the party on an adventure to hunt down a villain, the GM can have their quarry flee into the mountains. Instead of bandits along the road, the party now has to be on the lookout for stone giants who will more than likely capture and enslave the party. Instead of guarding a caravan along a trade road, they end up leading them through the Venridge Pass to make up lost time. The stories of mountain trolls are probably not true anyway.

Also included is a new character background, new equipment, new weapons and a new magic items related to this particular environ.

198398.name: Werde der neue Zar
198398.description:
A world map with 22 countries, each with different ressoruces.

Players strive for world domination starting with 2 small villages and 2 horses. With strategic retail one player will outperform the opponents and become the new Tsar.

AIM OF THE GAME
Players have to occupy countries with their horses, houses or castles to receive winning points. To win the game, 15 points have to be collected.

GAME PLAY:
Every player starts his journey with 2 horses and 2 huts which are placed in a certain order.

Then it is time to collect the resources of every country. From now on, every turn a player rolls 3 dice and adds up the numbers. The total determines which country receive resources. Every player who has one or more buildings in this country, receive the appropriate resource. If a player rolls a 3, 4, 16, 17, or 18 he must return half of his cards to the bank.

Using these resources, players can update their buildings and thus their influence on the different areas.

198399.name: B ATAKY!
198399.description:
B ATAKY! ("To the attack!") is a Soviet-era board game described as being for secondary school students clearly has its roots in chess, with a mapboard laid out in squares, 15 across by 20 deep. There are three terrain features: a six-square box at the centre of each side representing the headquarters that must me captured; a river (which slows movement) across the middle, two squares wide in the centre and one square on the sides; and four yellow squares on each side closest to the players, which are reserve areas in which pieces may be placed but not attacked.

Each side starts with 21 pieces: 8 infantry, 4 tanks, 4 artillery, 3 missiles and 2 airplanes. As in chess, each piece moves differently and destroys an enemy piece by moving onto its square.

All moves are orthogonal, and pieces may attack in any of the four directions. Infantry may move one or two squares. Tanks may move 1 - 3 spaces. Missiles may move up to 5 spaces but when attacking are destroyed along with their target. Artillery moves one space but may attack a target up to 3 spaces away (without moving to that square). Airplanes may attack up to 10 squares away. Finally, each player may record one space that is mined and will destroy an enemy piece that moves onto it.

There is a screen that allows players to make their initial placements in secret. The first player makes a single move; his opponent then makes two; the first player makes two; and then the opponent makes three. Thereafter each player's turn includes three moves, enabling a variety of assaults, probes and counter-attacks.

198400.name: Inte ens nära!
198400.description: Inte ens nära ("Not even close") is a quiz game. The player draws and read questions from a deck of cards. All players gets the same questions. This is not about being able to answer the questions, but instead of figuring out a guess and be the one who manages to end up being closest to the correct answer. The game only have crazy, twisted and quirky questions.

198401.name: Dott. Coyote
198401.description:
User summary:

This Italian-language game adapts the Looney Tunes cartoons featuring Wile E. Coyote to the table-top. One player - slightly like a traditional game master - plays Dr. Coyote. Dr. Coyote delivers a series of lectures on the construction methods of improbable traps. The other players have student characters. Play involves random distribution of cards containing trap components. Students then describe and construct their trap.

This game was submitted to the Italian-language Game Chef 2012 competition.

198402.name: Catch a Falling Star
198402.description:
The aim of Catch a Falling Star is just that - to catch falling stars and score points. The game mechanic is very simple - you simply move your basket left or right in order to catch the stars. At the same time, you must avoid hazards, like ice, which slows you down, for example. Various power-ups and power-downs will help or hinder you on your path to your best score yet.

Your basket fills up as you catch stars, and only once you deposit them on either side of the screen do you score the points. Depositing when your basket is full gives you bonus points, but the risks are higher, since missing a star makes you lose any stars you haven't deposited yet.

Source: The Game Website.

198404.name: Veglia
198404.description:
User summary:

This rules-light storytelling game focuses on the events surrounding a "vigil" that is being held for a singular event. Various concepts and questions are collaboratively developed and then addressed during play. The game sets up subsets of players to address specific concepts and questions, leading to a multi-layered resolution - or at least a multi-layered attempt at resolution.

This game was submitted to the Italian-language Game Chef 2012 competition.

198405.description:
This Hero Pack contains five all new Heroes to join the ranks of the Iron Inquision.

Captain: Torquemada
Gunner: Rosario Espina
Quartermaster: Vasco da Gama
Brute: El Verdugo
Swashbuckler: Diego de Almagro
198405.name: Rum & Bones: Iron Inquisition Heroes Set #1

198406.description: Dominion: Pathfinding is a replacement card for something originally included in Dominion: Adventures. This event allows you to place your +1 Card token onto an action supply pile.
198406.name: Dominion: Pathfinding

198408.name: Gekido: Bot Battles
boardgamepodcastepisode: #46: Ethnos six-pack review; Blood Rage on tap; CMON Expo round-up
198408.description:
In the not-too-distant future, the most entertaining sport in the world requires killer reflexes, a passion to succeed, and a degree in science or engineering. Bot battling is all the rage, and Gekido: Bot Battles gives 2-4 players the chance to enter the arena and face off in 30-minute fights. Each round, the bots lock onto a target, then roll dice to execute attacks. Through cunning moves and swift strikes, players can activate secret powers in the arena and eliminate the competition. The last bot standing takes home the electric glory!

•••

Description of the first edition:

For a long time the Lord of Gems — Jikan, the mightiest dragon of all — feared that another dragon could take his place as the most powerful dragon. Soon he realized that only his sons could compete with him, so Jikan swallowed them. For many years Jikan lived happily as the king, eating whole worlds for breakfast. But one day, during a heartburn crisis, he saw that his sons were battling in his stomach. The first one to win and escape the belly of Jikan will be the next Lord of Gems!

Gekido is a dice game in which each player controls a dragon, trying to beat other players by knocking their life dices from 6 points to zero. At each round, players rolls six 6 sided dice and try to score one of many combinations showed in his character sheet (pairs, three of a kind, four of a kind, etc), but watch out! If you fail on your gamble attempt you can hurt yourself instead of the enemy! As the battle gets more fierce, however, players would unlock new powers: when one of your life dices is reduced to zero, you gain new special abilities! The player who remains in play, knocking all opponent's life dices, wins the game.

198409.name: Disphoria
198409.description:
User summary:

This game requires exactly four players. Each player will select a character from King, Queen, Jack, or Joker. The character is, essentially, a role (and associated goal) in the game. The game subsequently is played in a series of scenes and involves card manipulations as a tracking mechanism. Opposed actions, or conflicts, are resolved by proposing two narrative results and then selecting one by a simple card play mechanic.

198410.name: Davy Crockett and the Alamo
198410.description:
From the publisher:

Remember the Alamo is a card game where players are trying to keep the Mexican Army from storming the Alamo and breaching the walls. Players are the defenders of the Alamo and will try to stop the onslaught of the Mexican Army.

Players will use their hand of cards to fight back even though they are severely outnumbered. The defenders can position cards to use set collection to utilize the powers on the card or can pass the cards to the player on the left. The players win the game by defeating Santa Anna and his army. The Mexican Army wins by breaching the walls of the Alamo.

198411.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 696)
198411.description:
In This Issue


Brief Word From Johnn
How to Roleplay Seducers, Ancient Evils, Law Enforcement, and Genius NPCs
How To Draw NPC Relationship Maps

198412.name: Twelve Heroes
198412.description:
In the two-player game Twelve Heroes, players are landlords who lead twelve units and aim to obtain land cards which are located in three regions. These land cards give you victory points, and the first player who has gained seven points wins.

Before the game begins, players choose twelve unit cards to construct a deck of their own. On your turn, you execute four phases: control, maintenance, income, and military. Military is the most important phase in a turn, during which you can muster, deploy, or move your units. You can also gain food. You consume action points to execute these actions. You need food to muster units and activate them. Managing food and maximizing synergies of units are the keys to winning the game.

Publisher's summary:

プレイヤーは領主となり、12枚のユニットを指揮して3つの地域に配置された土地カードの獲得を目指します。
土地カードには勝利点が記述されており、先に7勝利点を獲得したプレイヤーの勝利です。
ゲームの前に、プレイヤーは12枚のユニットカードからなる自分のデッキをつくります。
ゲームはターン性で、ターンは4つのフェイズ（支配・維持・収入・軍事）からなります。
ターンのメインとなる軍事フェイズでは、ユニットを召集・地域に派遣・地域から地域へ移動、という行動がとれます。また、食糧を直接的に入れることもできます。
これらの行動はアクションポイントによって実施されます。
ユニットの招集には食糧が必要であり、また、地域でユニットが活動するためにも食糧が必要となります。
食料のマネジメントとユニットのシナジーを最大化することがゲームのカギです。

198413.name: Fuhgeddaboudit!
198413.description:
A mob-and-road movie sandbox adventure

From the introduction:

It’s 1968 in Las Vegas, Nevada. Mobsters from all over the country are making a fortune off of skimming the casinos. There are three rules to follow in Las Vegas: no drugs, no killings and no wars. The Fruschetti family from New York City is part of a six way split of the Casablanca Casino. An accountant from the Bambino family in Newark, New Jersey was responsible for orchestrating the split until the Fruschetti family in Las Vegas found out they weren’t getting an equal share. Next thing you know, the order is given by the head of the Fruschetti family to take the accountant for a ride in the trunk of a Cadillac, direction: the desert.

198414.description:
Dwarven Smithy is 2-4 player, dwarven themed card crafting and hand/area management card game. Players work to gain gold by utilizing limited space in their workshop. Player craft items, gain special abilities and tools using a variety of resources. Players choose to draw resources and/or guild cards but the cards can also be purchase from other players or players can purchase resources from a warehouse. Use abilities to change the rules, tools to use fewer resources in making orders or sell crafted items. Special King's Items made for the King are revealed at the end of the game.

There are three types of Resources (metals, gems and runes) and four types of Guild cards(Apprentices, Tools, Items and King's Items). Metals and Gems must be refined into resources before they can be used to craft orders. Guild cards are crafted on the 3rd phase of your turn and then completed onthe 2nd phase of the next turn.

There are four phases of the game; Refine Resource cards, Complete Guild card, Actions (7), Draw cards. Refining turns metal and gems into refined resources. Orders crafted on the player’s previous turn are now complete and can be used. There are seven repeatable Actions in the game: Play a card, Craft a Guild card, Move or Swap a card,, Buy a card from another player, Buy a card from the warehouse, Discard a Guild card and Sell Resource cards. At the end of the player’s turn, player must draw four cards not to exceed their hand limit then turn cards placed into the market on their turn.

Play continues until one Player has completed four King's Orders, or the Guild deck or Mine deck runs out and then all players get one last turn. Resources are sold from the player's market and then the King's Orders are revealed, bonus gold is given for the highest valued King‘s Item (each subtype). Count up your gold coins and the player with the most gold at the end of the game wins.
198414.name: Dwarven Smithy

198415.description:
Promo card for the mafia card game La Cosa Nostra. The card depicts the founder of the German blog erklaerpeer.de

This special Gangster card is immune to the cards Snitch, Spy and the ability of the Lawyer. The Job card that is played on this card can never be looked at by other players, until it is revealed.
198415.name: La Cosa Nostra: Peer "The Gambler"

198416.name: Fall and Rise of Metal
198416.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have Abilities with values distributed from a point pool at creation. They also have a variety of traits, talents, and special abilities (primarily, derived from implanted biotech).

Action resolution involves an improbably complex process with a variety of inputs and optional values. A full-page action table flowchart is provided in the game.

198417.name: Something Like Alive
198417.description:
User summary:

The game uses a shared setting that is created collaboratively. The setting is assumed to be a huge space ship that is suffering frequent mechanical failures due to lack of maintenance.

The society aboard the space ship is fractured in a complex series of factions, each with different - possibly competing - goals. Characters belong to a faction depending upon which types of biotechnology they have been infected with. This biotechnology also determines many of a character's abilities.

Opposed actions are resolved with a dice roll mechanism. Difficult actions use a similar mechanism, though it will result in failure at least half of the time. The game suffers from poor organizational structure.

198418.name: Heist (2013)
198418.description:
From the introduction:

Heist is a roleplaying game with a small social footprint as its main feature. You should be able to pick it up sight unseen, start reading, and play. You learn the rules as you read along, and different players’ varying comfort level with acting in character is supported until the group gets their bearings. Once your group has completed the first play through and internalized the rules, you can replay it (with drastically different results), write your own playset, or download and play someone else’s. Included in this version is an intro playset, Fort Neuby, based on a standard dungeon crawl formula.

User summary:

The game requires a stripped pack of French playing cards as well as the Heist: Mystery Cards provided as a separate document.

198419.name: Heist: Mystery Cards
198419.description:
User summary:

The game Heist uses a stripped pack of French playing cards, as well as a deck of Mystery Cards. This accessory provides eight Mystery Cards as print-and-play components to support the game.

198420.name: The Pursuit of Happiness
198420.description:
User summary:

This rules-light live-action roleplaying game is for two players. They assume the roles of Sam and Jamie, two private investigators (Jamie is the rookie partner). They have been hired by a "client" to pursue an unusual investigation. Play involves visiting a number of determined sites of significance to the client that has hired the investigators. During these visits, the client is described. If additional players desire to participate, they may assume minor roles.

198421.name: Ancient Finds
198421.description:
How Many Artifacts Can You Find?
Explore the Mediterranean searching for ancient artifacts, collect the most valuable artifacts to win the game!

Overview:
Explore the Mediterranean searching for ancient artifacts. Roll the dice to match numbers on your discovery cards and collect artifacts of tile fragments, gold, and pottery. Hire archaeologists, purchase bonus excavation sites and calculate your chances with adventure cards to collect more ancient finds!

198422.name: Achtung! Cthulhu Skirmish
198422.description:
Set around the events of ‘the Secret War’ Achtung! Cthulhu Skirmish introduces players to the terrifying conflict fought to stop the sorcerous Nazi cult of the Black Sun from unleashing a tide of Mythos horrors against the Allies. Achtung! Cthulhu Skirmish: Rise of the Black Sun is the title of the first wave of releases during 2016 which will complete a whole story arc set around the first battles fought by the secretive Allied forces Section M, set up by the British to combat the Mythos threat and their US counterparts Majestic.

Set against them are arrayed the powerful forces of Exarch Weissler’s Black Sun, who as well as conventional troops and weapons can bring devastating magical power to the battlefield, summon ancient and terrible creatures like the Servitors of Nyarlathotep as well as powerful allies such as the Deep Ones and Mi-Go.

Take command of brave Allied forces like Badger’s Commandos and the Pathfinder Demon Hunters alongside historical army units, and lead them to victory against the Axis hordes. Deploy special hero units like Sgt Brandon Carter, Professor Richard Deadman or Ariane Dubois to take on the might of the Nazi war machine.

As the Axis, strike terror into your opponents by commanding the sorcerous Black Sun and their Mythos allies, bringing new levels of fear onto the battlefield. Call on the terrifying Deep One War Party or let the unholy Servitors of Nyarlathotep supplement your forces and crush the Allied threat.

Achtung! Cthulhu Skirmish is powered by Spartan Games’ Dystopian Legions 2.0 rules set (re-written by Matthew Hope (Relic Knights, AE-WWII, Wrath of Kings, Sedition Wars). The game allows for fast playing battles from small skirmishes up to full scale conflicts. Modiphius has added new rules for Mythos powers, creatures, artefacts and spells to allow players to experience the full flavour and terror of the Achtung! Cthulhu universe with their heroes and troops. The range is designed to work alongside other popular 28mm miniature lines.

Commander set contents: 144 Page Rulebook, 1 A5 Template Sheet, 1 A5 Token Sheet, 1 Tracker Sheet, 1 Double-sided Reference Sheet, 15 D6 (5 red, 5 blue, 5 black), 1 54 Card Deck (TAC cards, Mythos Events, Spell Cards)

Achtung! Cthulhu Skirmish Rules Feature:


A fast paced wargame rule set combining World War Two and the Cthulhu Mythos.
Uses the highly successful Dystopian Legions by Spartan Games for a fun but challenging tactical experience.
Based on the award-winning Achtung! Cthulhu roleplaying game setting by Modiphius Entertainment with
A major cast of heroes and villains, secret organisations, terrifying horrors and ancient artefacts.
Track the growing influence of the Mythos over the battlefield. As the Mythos Influence Level rises, strange and terrible things begin to happen to those involved in the conflict.
New Tactical Action Cards and ‘Model Assigned Rules’— MAR’s that capture the feel and flavour of the Achtung! Cthulhu settings.
Introducing rules for Mythos powers, spells and artefacts.
Stats for Achtung! Cthulhu forces as well as normal historical infantry, support weapons, vehicles and tanks.
Players from both sides can bring powerful spellcasters to bear—weaving spells across the battlefield to ensure victory over their enemy.
Written and converted by Matthew Hope (Relic Knights, AE-WWII, Wrath of Kings, Sedition Wars)
Fully compatible with the existing Achtung! Cthulhu miniatures range.
Expand your campaigns with hero and villain characters like Sgt Brandon Carter, Ariane D’bois or ‘Sweet’ Liesel Bohm, Adawolfa Gabler, or Franz ‘the Blackbird’ Amsel.
Call for reinforcements like the Deep One war party, Servitors of Nyarlathotep, Badger’s Commandos or
Demonhunter Pathfinders to rule the battlefield.
All purchases come with free download of our massive Forest of Fear background storyline and full campaign briefing with full mission suite for both Section M and Black Sun operatives.
Narrative base campaigns and expansion sets throughout the year will expand and enhance your adventures!

198423.name: The Emperor's Garden
198423.description:
User summary:

This rules-light storytelling game puts players in charge of characters in a kingdom undergoing upheaval due to a change in ruler. Play proceeds in turns of collaborative narration; rules involve only who is able to narrate. During play, tokens are distributed among characters depending on the outcome of their efforts. In a second phase of the game the tokens are counted and another round of play transpires depending on the predominant form of token received.

The game is distributed as a ZIP archive containing four copies of the game, varying only in file format: PDF, Text, Markdown Text, and HTML.

198425.description:
Make the fastest route from one place to another in Norway .

For example: You are in Svolvaer and may only travel further by car or boat . Do you find a destination that suits ?

Travel by plane, boat , train, bus or car to seven sites in Norway . Put your cards together for the fastest itinerary , complete the journey first and win the game.
198425.name: På reise i norge

198426.name: Dear Deliverance
198426.description:
User summary:

The game is played as a series of Twitter exchanges ("tweets") between two players. Any number of people may watch the game, but only the two players may contribute. The rules put forward a method of creating the scenario and then playing it out via back-and-forth narrative (necessarily short).

Although the game specifically is intended for Twitter, the mechanics are simple enough that it could readily be adapted to, essentially, any form of relatively anonymous, non-verbal communication.

198427.name: The Black Death
198427.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

The Black Death is a survival game set during the medieval era.

198429.name: Lachek
198429.description:
User summary:

This minimalist game was developed for the Game Chef 2014 competition. The setting is the cite of Emmaloopen, the capital city of Habwe. Emmaloopen is cosmopolitan and dangerous. Characters survive by avoiding both gangs and guards. The city features a type of street slang, or cant, that is minimally defined.

Generally, the game is unplayable as presented but may be approached as a rudimentary setting.

198430.name: Dino Dearest
198430.description:
Dino Dearest is a game about winning the hearts of a variety of dinosaurs and prehistoric dinosaur-like animals. If you like wildly branching storylines, cool music, parallax, or being consumed by spaghetti, this game might be for you.

Source: The Game Website.

198431.name: Tyto Ecology
198431.description:
Build your biome! With an empty biodome as your canvas, add plants and animals from three different ecosystems. Observe realistic interactions like hunting, blooming, and even decomposing! Will your biodome last for decades, or will it experience a total ecosystem collapse? You’re in control!

Source: The Game Website.

198432.name: Wait Up, Grandpa!
198432.description:
From the designer:

Grandpa is visiting, and you and a sibling are going out with him. Your delicious destination: the ice cream stand in the park. Your walk will take you through eight friendly neighborhoods, and there are plenty of interesting objects to explore and collect along the way: stones, insects, bottlecaps and such—pretty much anything you can stuff into your pockets. Stay out of the mud puddles, though, or your mom won’t be happy with you when you get home.

For each round, one player rolls all the dice. Grandpa moves along the path automatically, then each player will have a choice of moves. It's good to maneuver yourself into going first, since that player will have first crack at snapping up objects, but he will also have to deduce what his opponent might do. Other considerations for both players include getting more different objects than their opponent, when to re-roll their dice, and the need to stay close to Grandpa. If you lag too far behind you'll have to entreat Grandpa to "wait up!"-- which will yield negative victory points at the end of the game.

Light fun for kids and semi-serious gamers, Wait Up, Grandpa! provides 30 minutes of game time well-spent.

Components:
1 Game Board
5 Dice in three colors (2 blue, 2 red, 1 gray)
24 Object cubes in eight colors
10 “Wait Up/Hurry Up, Grandpa!” markers, double-sided
3 Mud puddle markers
2 Player tokens (1 blue, 1 red)
1 Grandpa token (gray)

198433.name: Pyre
198433.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




In Pyre, you lead a band of exiles through an ancient competition spread across a vast, mystical purgatory.

Pyre once again showcases our team’s commitment to rich atmospheric presentation and storytelling, along with a distinctive gameplay blend that combines expressive decision-making on the world map with fast, action-packed confrontations against rival groups of exiles whose own freedom is at stake. We want to create a large cast of characters you can grow close to as you travel together across a strange and wondrous land.

Source: The Developer Website.

198434.name: Magic: The Gathering Puzzle Quest
198434.description:
DESCRIPTION

The original match-3 RPG! comes to the Multiverse in Magic: The Gathering – Puzzle Quest. Recruit your favorite Planeswalkers, build powerful decks and defeat your enemies in match-3 battles! Magic: The Gathering – Puzzle Quest adds the extensive universe of the acclaimed TCG to the engrossing gameplay of the Puzzle Quest franchise, as players participate in quests, daily events and tournaments for epic rewards.

FEATURES

MATCH AND CAST SPELLS
Match gems to collect mana and unleash a powerful arsenal of spells against your enemies. Wage match-3 war against a legion of worthy foes as you battle your way across the Multiverse.

OUTTHINK YOUR RIVALS
Test your skills as you craft the perfect deck and climb to the top of the leaderboards in competitive player-versus-player combat! Prepare and strategize what creatures and spells are needed to overcome an ever-growing collection of single player challenges.

CUSTOMIZE YOUR SPELLBOOK
Build a worthy deck and battle some of Magic: The Gathering’s most deadly forces. Powerful spells such as Tragic Arrogance or ferocious creatures like Avaricious Dragon await combat on the match-3 battlefield.

RECRUIT ALLIES
Choose the most powerful Planeswalkers in the Multiverse and build a deck worthy of these formidable mages. Stay several steps ahead of your enemy with Jace, the master of deception or unleash the explosive fury of Chandra, the pyromantic fire mage.

UNLEASH YOUR PLANESWALKER
Use your Planeswalker’s unique abilities like Chandra’s Flameshot to annihilate your enemies, or Liliana’s Necromancy to raise the dead. Level up your Planeswalker and spells to crush your foes

Source: The Publisher Website.

198435.name: Song of the Deep
198435.description:
Song of the Deep is a metroidvania-style action-adventure game following a young girl’s quest into the unknown to find her missing father. Combining discovery, skill, and suspense with an unforgettable narrative, this underwater journey will challenge players to explore, experiment, and skillfully navigate a vast ocean landscape.

Source: The Developer Website.

198436.name: One Way Trip
198436.description:
User Summary

When a mass poisoning leaves much of the nation with only six hours left to live, during which time they will be hallucinating constantly, you and your brother must decide how to spend them, and whether or not to hunt for a cure!

198437.name: Rooms of the Inn
198437.description:
From the introduction:

The Inn is a dungeon. It is a campaign setting. It is a town or even just a home for the parties to come back to and visit. It can be and is whatever you need it to be. Literally offering its guests worlds of opportunities.

The Inn is as expansive and expandable as any premade dungeon has ever been and much more than others could have ever hoped to be. It provides your characters a place to grind, explore, call home and anything else you and your party wants it to be in order to do whatever is the most important part for you.

At the Inn there are many thousands of Rooms available. These Rooms can be explored, exploited, conquered and controlled. The backup dungeon master’s campaign setting can even be in a Room, making switching campaigns both easy and part of the story line. The only limits of what possibilities there are, are the limits you set for yourself.

198438.name: The Roman on the Rhine
198438.description:
User summary:

This highly unusual game is presented in two components, only one of which is required for play. The first, optional, component is an HTML presentation of the layout and flow of the game's rules, structure, setting, and scenario. The second, required, component is an approximately 66-minute long MP3 sound file. The sound file contains everything necessary to play the game, including an audible description of play (e.g., the rules). The sound file contains background music derived from other sources (credited in the HTML description). The game is diceless and "paperless" and is intended to be playable while driving in a car (e.g., a road trip game).

198439.description:
The Olympians are more wrathful than ever, and Zeus has opened the gates to dread Tartarus itself. Unleash Legendary Monsters from Greek mythology on the faithless mortals in this colossal expansion for Monstrous - the game of mythic mayhem.

The Release the Kraken expansion for Monstrous includes one Location card (Tartarus), as well as 8 Legendary Monster cards and 10 Tentacle cards. Players who hit Tartarus with a monster get to draw a Legendary Monster.

The Kickstarter edition of Monstrous included the Dark Ages edition of this expansion, using public domain art. A Kickstarter for a full art version of the expansion is planned for 2016.
198439.name: Monstrous: Release the Kraken

198440.name: Alien Love Isn't an Act
198440.description:
User summary:

This innovative game uses a dice pool mechanic to resolve difficult situations. Character creation involves distributing points among Attributes and then selecting a "Role" card that provides basic character motivation and traits. Play transpires on a large double-sided printed surface that combines elements of a character sheet on one side and a large Action Table (state table) on the other side.

The game is distributed in a ZIP archive containing:


Package Notes (one-page PDF of game comments)
Notecards (six-page PDF of print-and-play components)
Chargen & Storyboard (two-page, large-format PDF of print-and-play play surface)
Blank Character Sheet (two-page PDF)
Five pre-generated characters (two-page PDF, color documents)


The five provided characters are Alien Al Pacino, Alien Bruce Willis, Alien Judi Dench, Alien Meryl Streep, and Alien Morgan Freeman.

Note the various PDF documents use different page sizes.

198441.name: Dust Tactics: Taskforce Rhino
198441.description:
Welcome to the new version of Dust Tactics! Whether you’re a new player or a veteran who wants to get into the Allied faction, this starter set is made for you!
Inside this Starter Set you’ll discover the new Dust Tactics rules and a complete army that will allow for countless games. This army is also a strong base to build a larger force upon, or to add to another Starter Set to field an even larger force! Everything you need to play is in the box, you just need to find an opponent!

CONTENT OF THIS BOX:

one hero, Rhino
one squad of three Hammers
one Wildfire walker
one rule booklet with the introductions rules to Dust Tactics
twelve Dust dice
one tank trap
one ammo crate
six terrain tile
one gaming mat
one catalog
one leaflet




These miniatures come with their unit cards, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules.
Like all regular Dust miniatures, these are already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as wish! You can paint directly on them, since the priming serve as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

198442.name: The Executioner
198442.description:
From the front cover:

The locals are spreading rumors of the emergence of an age-old relic in a remote farming village. Surely you won’t be the only one to seek it, but can you afford to not be successful in this mission? And why haven’t they claimed it for themselves?
Part Three of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A Two-Hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters

198443.name: The Marionette
198443.description:
From the front cover:

A Vistani fortuneteller has called you out by name during the Burgomaster’s private reading. She raved of an army of the dead, a delicate powderbox, and a beautiful yet dangerous woman. Now the Burgomaster wants to know why you’re more important than he is...
Part Four of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A Four-Hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters

198444.name: The Seer
198444.description:
From the front cover:

The time has come to venture beyond the village of Orașnou and explore the realm of Barovia. However, in your travels, you happen across an unusual tribe of people--distrusted denizens of the Demiplane of Dread. Do the Vistani truly possess the ability to see the future, or is it simple parlor tricks and deceit? Part Five of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A Two-Hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters

198445.name: Kill the king
198445.description:
Kill the king is a strategic board game where two players control one army each. One player attacks a castle while the other player try to defend it and prevent the attackers from killing the king. The attackers have to hurry because the defenders will soon be reinforced by its own cavalry. Returning to save the day.

You can also play two alternate game modes of Kill the king in addition to the normal mode.
The first is a regular battle between the two players armies outside the castle walls. The second is a big version of the normal mode where you combine two game boards. One player defends the combined castle of the two game boards, while two players try to attack the castle on one side each.

The pictures are not from the finished game but from the prototypes.

198446.name: En busca de la ciudad perdida de Garan
rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
198446.description:
Portada:

Un gran misterio aguarda en lo más profundo de las junglas de Cirinea: la legendaria ciudad perdida de Garan. ¿Serán nuestros aventureros capaces de sobreponerse a todos los peligros que acechan en la espesura y descubrir, al fin, las míticas ruinas del desaparecido reino del héroe elfo Khaboras?

Contraportada:

Modulo para perdonajes de nivel 4-6 **
Este módulo ha sido especialmente diseñado para usarse con el reglamento de Aventuras en la Marca del Este. No obstante, podrá ser empleado con otros juegos similares con relativa facilidad y aplicando pocos cambios, incluyendo la quinta edición del juego de rol de fantasía por antonomasia.

Esta aventura trata de emular los viejos módulos que aparecieron en su día para el juego que Aventuras en la Marca del Este clona, como homenaje a un estilo muy particular y querido de entender esta afición, así como una no disimulada pretensión de establecer una línea de aventuras clásicas, con el aroma inconfundible de antaño, sencillas y adaptables, sin pretensiones, como aquellas que jugábamos hace ya más de veinte años

198447.description:
"Give me the child. Through dangers untold and hardships unnumbered, I have fought my way here to the castle beyond the Goblin City to take back the child that you have stolen, for my will is as strong as yours, and my kingdom as great."

Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Board Game is a beautiful exploration of the movie for 1-5 players in which Sarah, Ludo, Sir Didymus and Hoggle must adventure through the labyrinth and make their way to the goblin city to save Toby from Jareth, the goblin king!

The board is very simplistic, beautifully illustrated and dominated by the titular Labyrinth. This is the maze that players must navigate every time they wish to save Sarah’s baby brother. Each game is different with the blank card spaces being filled with the magical encounters and monsters that are depicted on the deck of cards that comes with the game, this ensures a great deal of replayability and unpredictability in the game, giving the Labyrinth its signature feel.

The game consists of two distinct stages, one in which the group must adventure through the labyrinth trying to find the goblin city whilst keeping their willpower as high as possible (nobody wants to fall into the oubliette!), and a second stage in which the players must fight their way into Jareth's castle where Sarah must say the magical words that will release her brother.
198447.name: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 021 – UK Games Expo 2016
Ep 42: Codenames, Marvel Zombies and TMNT:OOTS
THE GAME PIT: EPISODE 81 - PICKING OVER THE BONES

198449.description:
This brave company composes an entire MERCENARY GROUP (meaning they will work for any faction) featuring three Kickstarter Exclusive Swashbucklers, one Kickstarter Exclusive Brute, and one Kickstarter Exclusive Quartermaster.

Heroes:
Milady de Winter, Athorc, Orcamis, Porcos, and Gob'lingnan
198449.name: Rum & Bones: Tusketeer Hero Pack

198450.description:
"My phone alerts me — a new geocache has been published. A glance at the map makes me smile because I know this piece of woodlands! Here I grab my rubber boots and a towel, turn on the GPS device, and run to get the car. A cup of tea is left behind on the table, half-filled with tea that is still hot."

FTF: First to Find is a geocaching-themed card game that lets players experience the same kind of emotions that they would get from playing in the open air. One can choose between various types of geocaches, and whoever reaches to the cache first is the lucky winner, of course.

During set-up, players form a 7x7 square from landscape tiles from starting locations they select. During a player's turn, they can either move and reveal the current tile or just reveal the tile, based on the path chosen. Players can choose between searching three different cache types — normal, multi- and mystery cache — with all having different conditions for finding them.
198450.name: FTF: First to Find

198451.name: Aragami
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Stealth Game of the Year Nominee
198451.description:
EMBRACE THE SHADOWS

Create shadows to become invisible. Teleport to any shadow while you hunt down your targets. Use a wide array of Shadow Powers to creatively dispatch your enemies.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
198452.description:
Description from the publisher:

The house on the hill has a wicked reputation. Those who dare to darken its door often leave steeped in madness and despair — if they leave at all.

Now the horror reaches new heights with Widow's Walk, the first-ever expansion for the critically acclaimed board game Betrayal at House on the Hill. The house is expanded with the addition of twenty new rooms, including the roof, a previously unexplored floor. Also in its halls you will find new monsters, items, omens, events, and fifty brand-new haunts, penned by lead developer Mike Selinker's all-star cast of contributors from the world of gaming and entertainment. In Widow's Walk, terror and panic are taken to a whole new level.

Enter if you dare. Exit if you can...
198452.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill: Widow's Walk
boardgamepodcastepisode: #32: Interview w/designers Jessica Chu & Katie Khau (Windup War preview); Puerto Rico on tap; SeaFall first impressions
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 018 – Star Wars: Rebellion vs Star Wars: Imperial Assault
Episode 14 - Gaming Like it's 1999
Episode 60 - Interview with Lone Shark Games Mike Selinker
Podcast 37 – Betrayal at the House on the Hill
Vox Republica 129: Extra Life Extravaganza

198453.name: Gamecraft
198453.description:
Create the video game of your dreams! In Gamecraft you are in charge of a digital games studio, contracting employees with differing expertise and competing to find out who is the best game developer from Games S/A.

Start small, upgrade your studio and crew, buy improvements, and train your professional squad with new abilities. Choose which production areas to focus on because that's the only way to develop games by the deadline, create fandom, and get the best ratings in game magazines and at events. Gamecraft is a worker placement game with different levels of workers, many game combinations to create, and great visuals. Live three years of a game studio developing from small to complex games!

198454.description:
The night has fallen and your mind is floating in the magical world of dreams. But the Dream Spirits want to have some fun tonight! They are giving their best and the dreams become strange and surreal. Become the dreamer, put on your sleeping mask and try to figure out your dream and which spirits are the Naughty ones. Become a good spirit and help the Dreamer by giving him clues about the dream before the naughty spirits mess it up. Close your eyes and dive in 'When I Dream'!

At the beginning of each round of When I Dream one player takes the role of the Dreamer and "falls asleep", wearing a cloth mask. The other players are secretly dealt their role cards determining what kind of spirits they are "good" or "naughty" or if they are just "tricksters" changing sides as the game goes by.
The whole round lasts 120 seconds in which the spirits are drawing "Dream" cards depicting a specific element of the dream, trying to describe them to the dreamer using one word each. The dreamer can guess what the element of the Dream is at any time, placing the card to the good spirits team side if the guess was correct and in the naughty spirits pile if it was not.
At the end of the round the Dreamer and the good spirits get a point for every card in the good spirits pile, when the naughty spirits get one point for every card in the naughty spirits pile. The tricksters get points according to how well balanced the two teams were at the end of the round, gaining extra points if they managed to equally balance the two piles.

At the end of the round, the dreamer must use the words he guessed and story-tell his dream for extra points before he opens his eyes.

You can learn how to play in a few minutes and have a great laugh right from the start. Each role is challenging and entertaining giving the game more depth according to the player’s imagination, providing a wonderful experience with a unique dream every round.
198454.name: When I Dream
boardgamepodcastepisode: Perfect Information Podcast Episode 35 - When the Going Gets Tough
The Game Pit: Episode 70 - Spiel 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 1

198455.description:
Mystic ScROLLS is a real-time dice game when each player is a wizard trying to cast as many spells as possible to capture the mystic knowledge of the hidden scrolls. It plays for 2-4 players, 12 years old and up, and each game lasts around 20 minutes giving you a fun game filled with adrenaline.

Each wizard has his own spells and begins the round with 5 magic dice. When the players are ready, we draw a new scroll card at the middle of the table and the round begins!
During the round the players are rolling their dice as fast as possible, trying to match the symbols rolled with the symbols depicted on their spell cards to perform the spell, or in the middle scroll card to claim and cast it.
Players can reroll their dice as much as they wish in order to roll the desired symbols, performing more spells the faster they play.

If a player rolls dice matching the requirements of a spell he places the dice upon the spell and immediately receives new dice from the dice pool. When the dice pool is empty or when a player claims the scroll card the round ends and all the spells are being cast.
198455.name: Mystic ScROLLS
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 029 – Why Jam Improves Your Game
Epside 35 :: The Others + On The Couch with Josh and Brandon
The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 68: Tuesday, September 20th

198456.name: Motion Pictures: Movies Out of Cardboard
198456.description:
Description from the publisher:

Motion Pictures is a card game that uses a hand management mechanism with strong set collection and deck building elements.

At the beginning of the game, we have several available projects for the players to compete in.
Every turn a player can choose between three actions: shoot, hire and recast.
While shooting, a player places a filmmaker at an available project. If a project's requirements are met the player places the completed project in his score pile.
When hiring, a player takes an advanced filmmaker into his hand from the advance row by discarding another filmmaker of the same specialty. Advance filmmakers have multiple skills and special abilities.
Using the recast action, a player can draw a new card from his deck by discarding any one card from his hand.
The four types of projects have different requirements.
Movies need skills, based on their difficulty. Tv series need a defined number of skills while excluding some in particular. Commercials need specialties, not specific skills, whereas awards need exactly the skills shown on them and nothing more. Finally, there is also the trilogy in which all players can place filmmakers in secret during the course of the whole game and gain fame at the end according to the skills played.

After a project is completed it is replaced by a new one from the upcoming projects pile. When the pile is depleted, players play a last round before the era is completed. The game ends after four eras and the final scoring occurs.

It is a light to medium game, equally suited for families and gamers, and is recommended for players 12 years old and up. Two to four players can have the unique experience of managing a movie studio and each game lasts about forty minutes.

198457.name: B-Sieged: Darkness & Fury Exclusive Promo Miniatures
198457.description: This is a promotional set of 8 enemy miniatures in 4 Kickstarter exclusive sculpts (2 of each sculpt) that was only obtainable by ordering the Darkness and Fury expansion through the B-Sieged Kickstarter, not through any of the pledge levels.

198459.name: I'm With Stupid
198459.description: Being dumb is now fun with the I'm With Stupid Trivia Board Game. One of the most internationally recognized logos and sayings for over six decades, the global t-shirt phenomenon is now a multi-player board game. For ages 12 and older, the adult board game features bizarre and “Stupid" trivia with attitude. This game is designed for three or more players and will have everyone entertained. The I'm With Stupid Trivia Board Game includes one game board, a card box, 300 “Stupid" question cards, six game pieces with stands, one “Stupid" hat and easy-to-follow rules.

198460.name: The Class Hack
198460.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you enjoy THE BLACK HACK but wish you had more classes to add to it?

THE CLASS HACK presents 10 additional Classes inspired by the Original 1970's Fantasy Roleplaying game for the THE BLACK HACK OSR compatible clone.

Add the Assassin, Acrobat, Barbarian, Bard, Cabalist, Cavalier, Druid, Monk, Paladin, and Ranger to your campaign.

198461.name: Powers of the Lifechain
198461.description:
From publisher blurb:

he Lifechain is a star-spanning (and multiversal) ecosystem that binds mortal life firmly to the primordial gods who created the multiverse. The Lifechain is a web of blood and divine heritage which has touched billions of living worlds and millions of timelines. Lifechained creatures have powers far in excess of their kind. They are planetary champions, conquerors, heroes and messiahs, and they owe their vast gifts to the infusion of a few molecules of ancient, divine DNA.

All Lifechained creatures share a connection, however tenuous, to Phallus Space and its gods. Some Lifechained creatures are the direct descendants of one of the Third Pantheon’s dieties, and even if they do not know it, can trace their heritage back aeons to the dawn of the Multiverse.

Others are hereditary royalty, a genetically superior planetary champion whose bloodline has been preserved through gene-treatments and selective incest, in the hopes of breeding a superior creature. Other Lifechains are the products of experimentation and reverse engineering- artificially grafting Lifechained DNA to a humanoid genome, or are products of strange magic that awakens the Lifechained DNA lurking in otherwise ordinary creatures. The most feared and spectacular Lifechains are the monstrous Nemesis Lifesapwn, super-predators which hunt the cosmos in search of Lifechained prey.

Players might choose to enter the Lifechain by selecting a species with an innate Lifechained heritage (including several of the player species found in [Species of the Otherverse] or Culture of Choice). Even if a character comes from a species not normally known for its connection to the Lifechain, that character can choose the Awakened Heritage feat to unlock their divine heritage. Once a Lifechained heritage is unlocked, a character can choose additional Lifechained feats, offering new capabilities, anytime a new feat slot opens up.

Lifechain feats grant amazing powers. Lifechained creatures can shapeshift into virtually any form, heal wounds that would kill entire platoons of mortals, manipulate energy, unleash primal sorcery, alter molecular structure and reality, and some wield even stranger abilities! However, power comes with a price. A Lifechained creature is easily detected by another Lifechain, and some Lifechained abilities allow a Lifechained hunter to more easily kill his demi-god brothers and sisters.

Powers of the Lifechain is a companion to Horrors of the Lifechain, foucsing on player abilities, where the earlier sourcebook was a collection of setting-specific monsters.

198462.name: Culture of Choice
198462.description:
From publisher blurb:

Culture of Choice is a complete revision and rethinking of Otherverse America’s talents and feats, making this unique, military sci-fi setting fully compatible with the Pathfinder Role Playing Game.

Culture of Choice focuses on the Choicer Covenant and the pro-choice, feminist and militarized pagan nation’s iconic powers and abilities. Soon, similar soucebooks will delve into the factional talents of both the Lifer Army of God and the United States Fed-Gov.

Detailing the races, traits and superhuman feats available to Otherverse America’s Choicer heroes, this sourcebook is the definitive guide for building heroes…or adversaries… for this war-scarred, neo-pagan cyberpunk campaign setting.

Included in this comprehensive sourcebook:

Racial histories and statistics for the Fluxminx, Softling Healer and Ubasti player races, now fully compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
The introduction of the all new Pagan Born and RAINBOW Tribe player races.
Alternate Human race traits for Human heroes native to the setting.
Suggestions on importing races from other Otherverse Games settings into Otherverse America
Hundreds of new traits for Choicer heroes, including new supernatural and spell-like abilities which introduce magic to the setting while retaining its 22nd Century flavor.
Every Choicer-specific feat and power published to date, revised and expanded.
Powerful new feats like Legendary Weapon of Choice, Bastian Divinity, Point Defense Flames, Threefold Bitch and Flight Capability allow you to build more powerful, more capable and more interesting heroes than ever before.

198463.name: Species of Otherverse America
198463.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humanity began speciating during the 2030s, and the process has only accelerated since War’s End. Today, homo sapiens shares its homeworld with more than a dozen engineered species. New human subraces with incredible powers were custom-grown by mid 21st century mega-corps. Today, at the dawn of the 22nd Century, engineered species like Softlings, Couriers and Fluxminx live as free citizens of a divided America. Alien immigrants like the Half Grey and Stonecutters struggle to find a place for themselves on the human homeworld.

The Species of Otherverse America describes the 13 most common non-human races found in the Otherverse America campaign setting. In addition to comprehensive cultural files, a selection of unique racial feats for each species, short sidebars describe how to use these unique species in Otherverse Games’ other sci-fi settings: Psi-Watch and Galaxy Command.

This sourcebook is a core character creation manual for the Otherverse America Campaign Setting. It is a companion to Sexually Transmitted Future, which describes playing baseline human characters (and genetically engineering them) in detail.

198464.name: Ruckus Ridge VR Party
198464.description:
User Summary

Ruckus Ridge VR Party is an asymmetric virtual reality party game in which one player, wearing a VR headset, stands in the middle a battle arena randomly strewn with boxes, holding a light gun. Meanwhile, the "couch" players view the arena on a flat 2D screen from an overhead perspective, and their characters move around while hiding under the boxes.

The game features several different level types, each with a different objective for the couch players, such as collecting coins, or reaching the center of the arena, or playing hot potato with a bomb. The couch players must be careful in their actions however, as moving while the VR player is looking in their direction will signal their position and ensure a quick death.

The game has a free-play mode as well as a tournament mode, in which players take turns donning the headset over a set number of rounds and try to score the highest total of points.

198465.name: xChess
198465.description:
Description from the publisher:

xChess is based on a Hexagonal Chess Game invented in Canberra Australia, in 1973 by Wolfgang Flatow. The Flatow Chess Board is a 65 hexagon 8 x 4 x 4 hexagonal matrix, one more hexagon than the traditional 64 square matrix. The chess piece moves are intuitively and logically mapped by closely correlating adjacent and diagonal moves used by the traditional square Chess game. xChess has 2 openings, the Flatow opening can be played using a traditional set of pieces, having 2 bishops (all on the same diagonal grid) and the Fortress opening having 3 bishops (one for each diagonal grid) per side. The Game was refined over 2 years of intensive exploratory play by Canberra Chess enthusiasts and was self-published in 1976 in Australia.

The Flatow Chess Board and openings present the neatest and most compact form of Hexagonal Chess and xChess is the combination of the best openings and pawn variations discovered over the years.

The X in xChess stands for HeXagon, eXtra dimension, eXtra power, eXtra possibilities, eXtra fun and X Factor.

198466.name: Blockbusters Gold Run
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
English / European BBC Micro & Electron Cassette edition
English / European Commodore 16 / Plus4 Cassette edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
198466.description:
From the inlay:

GOLD RUN from Macsen Software is based on the well-known television series Blockbusters. The TV game is a Central Production made in association with Mark Goodson and Talbot Television.

User Summary

Blockbusters was a highly popular British TV show (though originally based on an American format) hosted by Bob Holness. Students, one single and one team of two, would compete to answer questions to fill in hexagons on a grid. Each hexagon was filled with a letter, and the answer to the question started with that letter. If a team answered a question correctly it would turn their colour (white or blue) and they could then choose the next location on the grid, leading to the famous catchphrase "Can I have a 'P' please, Bob?" (having a Pee is British slang for urinating).

The aim of the game is for the single student (playing white) to connect from top to bottom, a minimum of four spaces, and for the pair of students to connect from left to right, a minimum of five spaces.

Winning would allow the team to progress to the Gold Run, where a single student (the pair would alternate if they won multiple times) would attempt to cross a more complicated version of the board.

The first game in the series was a two player game that played the main game only. This standalone sequel is a single player game that includes the Gold Run only.

198468.name: Time Jockeys: Myths and Legends Expansion
198468.description:
A small expansion that adds the following items to the game:

Video Confirmation of Bigfoot

Excalibur (Taken)

Video Confirmation of the Loch Ness Monster

Baba Yaga's Hut (Taken)

Video Tour of The Lost City of El Dorado (Taken)

Water from the Fountain of Youth

Video Tour of Atlantis

Robin Hood's Bow and Arrows

198469.name: Time Jockeys: Vatican Edition Expansion
198469.description:
A small expansion that adds the following to the game:

The Cross

Video of the Resurrection

Video of Noah's Flood

Video of Moses Parting the Red Sea

Video of Moses getting the Ten Commandments

Video of The Last Supper

Video of the Sermon on the Mount

Video of Jesus Turning Water into Wine

198470.name: Choices: And the Sun Went Out
198470.description:
What if the sun inexplicably vanished only to return hours later? Investigate with your AI companion, Moti. Uncover conspiracies. Discover ancient religions. Travel the globe. Find out who is murdering scientists and what this has to do with the random disappearances of the sun. This is your journey, and only your choices can expose the truth.

Choices is a path-based adventure with a difference – the story regularly updates, and is ongoing. No one player can discover the entire story in a single play through. See how many other players travelled to the same place as you each time you conclude a story arc.

Are you ready?

FEATURES
An epic story which regularly updates. Who knows when you’ll see it all?
No instant deaths – but that doesn’t mean your journey will be without peril.
Choose to have your AI companion, Moti, appear directly on your Apple Watch.
See how many fellow adventurers ended up at the same location when each story arc ends.

Source: The Game Website.

198471.name: Albion's Legacy: The Old Kings
198471.description:
The Old Kings adds new characters and new quests to Albion's Legacy. It also adds disasters and companions.

Includes:

1 Rule Sheet
3 new Characters: King Uther, King Uriens, & King Leondegrance
2 new Quests: Preparing for War & Healing the Land
23 new cards: 3 Artifact & 20 Disaster
1 Token sheet

198473.name: Albion's Legacy: The Errant's Journey
198473.description:
The Errant's Journey adds new characters and quests to Albion's Legacy. It also adds Disasters and Advantages to the game as well as new mini game boards which can be used to expand the world outside of Camelot.

Includes:

1 Rule Sheet
4 new Characters: The Bard Taliesin, King Evelake, Lady Enide, & Sir Erec
2 new Quests: Outerworld Ritual & Restoring the Bastion
16 new cards: 4 Artifact & 12 Disaster
1 Token sheet

198474.name: Magic: The Gathering – Planechase: Chaos Reigns
198474.description:
Chaos Reigns is a five-color deck built around cascade, from Alara Reborn.

Planechase was originally released in 2009. This deck was released in 2012.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. The players may also use a "shared planar deck," which requires ten cards per player. Players cannot use more than one plane with any given name. When the game begins, the player going first reveals the top of his or her planar deck (or the shared planar deck), which is the plane the game starts on. Each plane card has a name, a type, one ability that applies at all times (either to all players or to whoever is the turn player at the time), and one "Chaos" ability.

Players also need a six-sided die, called the "planar die." Each Planechase pre-constructed deck comes with a "planar die" that has four blank faces, one "Planeswalk" face with the "Planeswalker" symbol, and one "Chaos" face with its own symbol unique to Planechase. During a player's main phase, that player can roll the planar die, with three possible outcomes. A blank roll of the planar die does nothing. If "Chaos" is rolled, the "Chaos" ability of the current plane card triggers. If the "Planeswalk" symbol is rolled, the player "planeswalks away" from the current plane (put it on the bottom of its owner's planar deck) and he or she reveals the top card of his or her planar deck, which becomes the new plane that has been "planeswalked to." A player can roll the planar die as many times as he or she likes, but successive rolls cost an additional one mana for each time the planar die has been rolled this turn.

Other than the above, the normal rules of the game are followed, and Planechase can be adapted to any multiplayer variant.

Planechase 2012 introduced the "phenomenon" card type. A player may have up to two different phenomenon cards in his or her planar deck, which cannot have the same name. When a player planeswalks to a phenomenon, he or she follows the instructions on the card, then immediately planeswalks away from it.

198475.name: Beer Pong Dice
198475.description:
No Table - No Problem
The famous drinking game without table.

Each team throw the dice up to five times to get a doublet.
If successful the current team marks the "cup" as a hit by turning another dice on the appropriate site. First team who have hit all "cups" wins.
